Summary: God chose David to be the king of Israel. He was a humble man who obeyed God. Therefore, God promised that David’s son would build God’s Temple and that one of David’s descendants would rule forever. He would be the Messiah, who would come 1,000 years later. After David sinned terribly, he repented and continued to obey God. Although God punished him for sinning, he still did everything he promised David he would do.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What kind of a man was Saul?<<ANSWER>>: Saul was tall and handsome, just like the people wanted. But he became a wicked man who did not obey God  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Who did God choose to become king after Saul?<<ANSWER>>: God chose a young shepherd from Bethlehem. He was humble and righteous, and he trusted and obeyed God  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Who was Goliath, whom David killed?<<ANSWER>>: Goliath was a giant enemy soldier who was three meters tall  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did David prove to Saul that he was not trying to kill Saul?<<ANSWER>>: David cut off a piece of Saul’s clothing in a cave. He could have killed Saul at that time, but he did not harm him. When Saul found out about it, he knew that David was not trying to kill him  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did David want to build for God?<<ANSWER>>: David wanted to build a temple where the Israelites could worship God and bring him sacrifices  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did God respond to David’s plan to build a temple?<<ANSWER>>: God sent the prophet Nathan to tell David he would not be the one to build a temple. Instead, David’s son would build it  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Who did God say would rule forever?<<ANSWER>>: One of David’s descendants would rule forever. This person would be the Messiah. But the Messiah would not come for almost 1,000 years after David died  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did David sin against God?<<ANSWER>>: David slept with Bathsheba. Then he murdered her husband, Uriah, who was one of David’s best soldiers  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did God punish David for his sin?<<ANSWER>>: God caused Bathsheba’s baby to die. He also made David’s own family fight against him  . |||<<QUESTION>>: In what ways was David different than Saul?<<ANSWER>>: The people wanted Saul to be king because he was tall and handsome. But he was a wicked man. God chose David to be king because David was humble and trusted and obeyed God. |||<<QUESTION>>: How might David have learned to be the king of Israel while he was a shepherd?<<ANSWER>>: While he was a shepherd, David learned to be brave and to protect his father’s sheep. As a young man, he even killed a bear and a lion when they attacked the sheep. Because of this, he was able to protect the Israelites against their enemies.|||<<QUESTION>>: Saul tried to kill David. Why did David not kill Saul when he found him in the cave?<<ANSWER>>: David did not want to sin in order to be king. He chose to wait until the time when God would make him king. Therefore, he did not kill Saul. Instead, he trusted God to protect him from Saul. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God not allow David to build a temple?<<ANSWER>>: David ruled Israel well, and God was pleased with David. God wanted David to be a good soldier for him. That was God’s plan for David. God wanted a different person to build a temple. David’s son would not be a soldier. He would be a builder. God would use him to build a temple. In this way, God would honor David by blessing his descendants.|||<<QUESTION>>: What was the greatest blessing that God promised to David?<<ANSWER>>: God promised David that one of his descendants would be the Messiah. He would rule over God’s people forever. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did David cause Uriah to be killed?<<ANSWER>>: David tried to hide his sin by killing Uriah. If Uriah was dead, David thought no one would know the king was the father of Bathsheba’s baby.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God punish David after he repented?<<ANSWER>>: God forgave David when he repented. But because David had dishonored God before the people, God had to punish him. David accepted that punishment and obeyed God.|||

Summary: Life was very difficult for Mary when she became pregnant. Her friends and family, and even her fiancée, did not believe that the baby was from God. However, God intervened to tell Joseph to marry her. Joseph obeyed and kept her a virgin until Jesus was born. Joseph and Mary were all alone When Jesus was born. But God sent his angels and the wise men to celebrate his birth!
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Why did Joseph decide to divorce Mary quietly?<<ANSWER>>: Mary was pregnant, and Joseph knew it was not his baby. Therefore, he decided to divorce her. However, he decided to have mercy on her and not to shame her. Therefore, he was going to divorce her quietly  . |||<<QUESTION>>: The angel told Joseph how Mary became pregnant. How did he say this happened?<<ANSWER>>: The angel told Joseph that the Holy Spirit placed the baby in her  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What does the name **Jesus** mean?<<ANSWER>>: It means ***Yahweh saves***  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How long did Mary remain a virgin?<<ANSWER>>: Joseph did not sleep with her until after she had given birth  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Joseph and Mary need to travel to Bethlehem?<<ANSWER>>: Their ancestor, King David, was born in Bethlehem. The Roman officials told everyone to travel back to where their ancestors lived. Therefore, Joseph and Mary went to Bethlehem  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Who told the shepherds that the Messiah was born?<<ANSWER>>: An angel told the shepherds that the Messiah was born. Then many other angels also appeared to the shepherds, praising God for what he had done  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did the shepherds do after the angel told them about the Messiah?<<ANSWER>>: The shepherds went to Bethlehem and found the baby in the feeding trough, just as the angel had told them  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did men come from the east to see the baby?<<ANSWER>>: They studied the stars and saw an unusual star in the sky. They knew this meant the king of the Jews had been born. Therefore, they came to see him  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did the wise men do when they saw the child?<<ANSWER>>: They bowed down and worshiped him, and they gave him expensive gifts  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Joseph learned that Mary was pregnant, and knew he was not the father of the baby. Why do you think he decided to have mercy on Mary?<<ANSWER>>: Joseph believed that Mary was pregnant because she had been unfaithful to him and had slept with another man. Joseph could have been angry with Mary and wanted to punish her. Joseph was a righteous man, and did not want to marry an adulteress. However, he was a good man, and it appears that he loved Mary. Therefore, he decided to have mercy on her instead of punishing her. |||<<QUESTION>>: How might Mary have felt when people learned that she was pregnant?<<ANSWER>>: Mary must have been very sad when people learned that she was pregnant, because they did not believe that her baby was from the Holy Spirit. Everyone thought she was an adulteress. Even Joseph thought she had sinned, and did not want to marry her. However, Mary knew that she had obeyed God and was still a virgin. She waited patiently until God told Joseph that she was faithful, and that he should marry her.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Joseph not sleep with Mary until the baby was born?<<ANSWER>>: God told Joseph that Mary was a virgin and that the baby inside her was from God. Perhaps Joseph was so amazed that the Son of God was in Mary’s womb that he kept her a virgin. Or perhaps he wanted to be able to tell everyone that Mary’s baby could not possibly be the result of a human father. Therefore, he did not sleep with her until Jesus was born.|||<<QUESTION>>: How was the location of Jesus’ birth different than where you would expect the Son of God to be born?<<ANSWER>>: Joseph and Mary were forced to travel far away to another city while she was pregnant. She gave birth to Jesus in a place where animals were kept. They were too poor to be able to find a proper room to stay in. None of their family or friends were with them. Joseph and Mary honored and obeyed God. And Jesus was the Messiah, the Son of God. However, they still faced many difficult situations. But God took care of them during that time.|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God do to encourage Joseph and Mary after Jesus was born?<<ANSWER>>: God sent the shepherds to tell Joseph and Mary about the angels that visited them. He also sent the wise men who brought expensive gifts and worshiped Jesus. |||

Summary: After Jesus went up to heaven, the believers continually met to pray together. Soon God sent the Holy Spirit to do a mighty work in them. He enabled them to speak in the native language of every person to whom they spoke. People were amazed at this. They listened to Peter as he told them that Jesus, whom they had crucified, had become Lord and Messiah and had sent the Holy Spirit to do this. When they heard this, 3,000 immediately believed in Jesus and were baptized. As they continued to meet together, other people saw how they praised God and helped each other. As a result, the church continued to grow.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Why did the believers constantly gather together in Jerusalem?<<ANSWER>>: They continually gathered together to pray  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to the believers as they were gathered together during Pentecost?<<ANSWER>>: As the believers were gathered together, the house was filled with the sound of a strong wind and something like flames of fire appeared over their heads. They were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other languages  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What astonished the crowd when they came to see the believers?<<ANSWER>>: They heard the believers speaking in the native language of each person in the crowd  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Peter reply when the crowd said the believers were drunk?<<ANSWER>>: Peter told the crowd that they were not drunk, but that this was the Spirit of God poured out on the believers as the prophet Joel had said long ago  .|||<<QUESTION>>: According to Peter, how did God the Father honor Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: God the Father honored Jesus by making him sit at his right hand, and by making him both Lord over everything and the Messiah  .|||<<QUESTION>>: When the people asked Peter what they should do, how did he reply?<<ANSWER>>: Peter told them to repent so that God would forgive them and to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How many people believed what Peter preached and became disciples of Jesus that day?<<ANSWER>>: About 3,000 people believed Peter and became disciples of Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the new believers do together in Jerusalem?<<ANSWER>>: They continued to listen to the teaching of the apostles. They also met, ate, and prayed together. And they continually praised God together and shared everything they had with each other  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What was the main thing the believers continually did when they gathered together?<<ANSWER>>: Prayer was very important to the believers. They continually gathered together to pray to God as a group, in addition to praying individually. Perhaps that is why God did such powerful works among them.|||<<QUESTION>>: How did the gift of speaking in other languages help the believers proclaim the message of Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: The people in Jerusalem knew the believers could not speak the native languages of everyone in the crowd. When they heard and saw them do this, they knew it was a miracle. Therefore, they were ready to listen to Peter as he preached to them. They could also speak to any person from any language group about Jesus, and that person would understand completely what they said.|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Peter tell the crowd about Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Peter told them that they had crucified Jesus, but that God had raised him from the dead just as the prophets had said he would. Peter and the believers were eyewitnesses of this. Peter also said that God had honored Jesus by making him sit at his right hand in heaven, and that it was Jesus who was sending the Holy Spirit.|||<<QUESTION>>: How did people respond to Peter’s message?<<ANSWER>>: God caused the people to be deeply moved so that they asked Peter what they should do. God will not always cause people to respond in this way, but on that occasion, 3,000 people believed the message and repented.|||<<QUESTION>>: How did the people of Jerusalem react when they saw that the believers continually met together to pray, praise God, and share with each other?<<ANSWER>>: When everyone in Jerusalem saw how the believers treated each other and praised God, they thought well of them, and many more people became believers.|||

Summary: The people in both of the kingdoms refused to believe that God would punish them. Even after God sent the Assyrians to destroy the kingdom of Israel, the people in the kingdom of Judah refused to repent and obey God. Therefore, God sent the Babylonians to destroy them as well. They were in exile in Babylon for 70 years before God caused a new king to allow them to return to Jerusalem. God made it possible for them to rebuild the Temple and the city of Jerusalem and to worship him there again.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What nation did God send to destroy the kingdom of Israel?<<ANSWER>>: God sent the Assyrians to destroy the kingdom of Israel. The Assyrians were very cruel. They killed many of the Israelites and took the rest of them to Assyria  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Who did the Assyrians bring to live in the land of Israel?<<ANSWER>>: The Assyrians brought foreigners to live in the land of Israel. These foreigners married the Israelites who were left in the land. Their descendants were called Samaritans  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did the people in the kingdom of Judah do when they saw how God had punished the kingdom of Israel?<<ANSWER>>: The people in the kingdom of Judah continued to worship idols, including the gods of the Canaanites. They refused to believe the prophets whom God sent to warn them  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What nation did God send to attack the kingdom of Judah?<<ANSWER>>: God sent the Babylonians to attack the kingdom of Judah. As a result, the king of Judah promised to pay a lot of money each year to Nebuchadnezzar, the king of the Babylonians  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did Nebuchadnezzar do to the kingdom of Judah when they rebelled against him?<<ANSWER>>: Nebuchadnezzar sent his army to destroy Jerusalem and the Temple. They took away all the treasures of the city. They also killed the king’s sons and made him blind. Then they led him away to Babylon  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Who remained in the land of Judah during the Exile?<<ANSWER>>: The Exile is the time when many of the people of Judah were forced to go away to Babylon. During this time, Nebuchadnezzar left only the poorest people in the land  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Did God forget his people after he punished them by sending them into exile?<<ANSWER>>: God did not forget his people as they were away from the land. He continued to send his prophets to speak to them for him. He promised that they would return to the land after 70 years in Babylon  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did the Jews return to the land of Judah?<<ANSWER>>: God caused the Persians to defeat the Babylonians. Cyrus, the Persian king, allowed the Jews to return to Jerusalem. He gave them money to rebuild the Temple. Many of the Jews returned to Jerusalem. They also rebuilt the walls of the city  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Does it seem right that God would send the cruel, evil Assyrians to destroy his people?<<ANSWER>>: God warned the kingdom of Israel that he would punish them, but they would not repent. Therefore, God sent the Assyrians to destroy them. Even though the Assyrians were a cruel people, God allowed them to defeat Israel in order to punish Israel. Later, however, he punished the Assyrians by allowing the Babylonians to defeat them.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the people in the kingdom of Judah refused to repent after the Assyrians destroyed the kingdom of Israel?<<ANSWER>>: People normally think they are not as bad as other people. Perhaps the people of the kingdom of Judah thought they were better than the people in the kingdom of Israel. They thought God would not punish them in the same way. But they were wrong. God sent his prophets to tell them that he would punish them if they did not repent. And he punished them just as he said that he would.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the Babylonians were able to destroy the Temple in Jerusalem?<<ANSWER>>: The Temple was the place where God stayed with the Israelites. However, God did not stay with them because they sinned against him and worshiped other gods. Therefore, God left the Temple and allowed the Babylonians to destroy it.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the prophets say that the Israelites would only be in exile for 70 years?<<ANSWER>>: God decided to allow the Jews to return to Judah after 70 years in exile in Babylon. He also decided to cause Cyrus and the Persians to defeat Babylon in order to let the Jews leave and go home to Judah. Since God knew beforehand that he was going to do this, he sent his prophets to tell the Jews that he would do these things.|||<<QUESTION>>: How were the Jews able to rebuild the Temple?<<ANSWER>>: God provided everything the Jews needed to rebuild the Temple. He even caused Cyrus, the king of the Persians, to give them the money they needed to rebuild the Temple. God wanted to live with his people there again. So he made it possible for them to rebuild the Temple where he would live with them. |||

Summary: God led the Israelites into the Promised Land and helped them defeat all their enemies. He did this in a way that showed how powerful he is. He stopped the waters of the Jordan River. He knocked down the walls of Jericho. He caused hail to fall that was big enough to kill the Amorites. And he made the sun stand still to help Israel. When he accepted Rahab and her family, he also showed that he will accept anyone who believes in him. And he worked powerfully through Joshua to give Canaan to Israel. This showed that he kept his covenant with Abraham.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Why did the two spies promise to protect Rahab the prostitute and her family?<<ANSWER>>: Rahab believed in God and helped the spies escape from Jericho  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did God enable the Israelites to cross the Jordan River?<<ANSWER>>: He caused the water upstream to stop flowing so the Israelites could walk across the river on dry ground  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did God make it possible for the Israelites able to defeat the city of Jericho?<<ANSWER>>: They marched around Jericho, blew their trumpets, and shouted. When they did that, God caused the walls of the city to fall down so they could attack the people  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to Rahab and her family when the Israelites destroyed Jericho?<<ANSWER>>: Joshua spared Rahab and her family, and they became part of the Israelites  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did the Gibeonites do so that the Israelites would not destroy them?<<ANSWER>>: They pretended to be from a country far away so the Israelites would make a peace treaty with them  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did the Amorites respond when the Gibeonites made peace with the Israelites?<<ANSWER>>: They joined their armies together to attack the Gibeonites  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What were the two miracles that God did to help the Israelites defeat the Amorites?<<ANSWER>>: God sent large hailstones to kill the Amorites, and made the sun stay in one place so the Israelites would have enough time to completely defeat them  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did God give to each tribe after they finished fighting against the Canaanites?<<ANSWER>>: He gave each tribe of Israel its own section of the Promised Land  . |||<<QUESTION>>: When Joshua called the Israelites together, what did they promise to do?<<ANSWER>>: They promised to be faithful to God and to obey his laws  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Rahab was a prostitute. But God accepted her and her entire family as part of Israel because she believed in God. What does that tell you about who God is?<<ANSWER>>: God is willing to accept any person who believes in him. It does not matter how much they have sinned. He will accept them even if other people do not think they deserve honor. |||<<QUESTION>>: God made a dry path through the Jordan River for Joshua and the Israelites. What had God done for Moses that was similar?<<ANSWER>>: God made a path through the Red Sea so Moses and the Israelites could escape the Egyptians. In a similar way, God made a path through the Jordan River for Joshua. Perhaps God wanted the Israelites to know that he would work through Joshua in the same powerful way as he worked through Moses.|||<<QUESTION>>: Would you expect the walls of a great city to fall down because a group of people marched around it and shouted?<<ANSWER>>: This is not a normal way to attack a city with high walls. However, Joshua and all the Israelites obeyed God and did what he told them to do. As a result, God caused all the walls to fall down so they could destroy the city. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the Israelites did not ask God about the Gibeonites?<<ANSWER>>: People often neglect to ask God for help unless they know they need him. Perhaps Joshua and the Israelites thought they could decide how to answer the Gibeonites without God’s help. Because they did not ask God, they made a terrible mistake. The Gibeonites deceived them, and the Israelites could not break their peace treaty with them.|||<<QUESTION>>: In what way did God show his power over creation when he helped the Israelites defeat the Amorites?<<ANSWER>>: God controlled the weather so that hailstones fell from the sky to kill the Amorites. He also caused the sun in the sky to stand still in order to make the day longer. Only Yahweh, who created all things, is able to do this.|||

Summary: A large crowd came to hear Jesus teach. There were so many people that he had to get into a boat in the water so that he had room to speak to them all. The people in the crowd would respond to his words in different ways. Some would not understand at all. Others would believe for a while and then fade away. But some would believe his words and serve God for their entire lives. For this reason, Jesus told the story about a farmer sowing seed. The seed fell on different kinds of soil, and it grew in different ways. The seed on the different kinds of soil represented the different people in the crowd. Jesus was telling the crowd and his disciples that they should pay attention to whether they believed the word of God. They should also make sure that they did not let anything else in their lives take the place of their love for God. If they continued to believe, they would accomplish much for God.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus get into a boat to teach the people?<<ANSWER>>: The people were crowding too tightly around him. So Jesus got into the boat so that he would have room to speak to all the people  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to the seed that fell on the path?<<ANSWER>>: The birds ate the seed that fell on the path  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to the seed that fell on rocky ground?<<ANSWER>>: The seed that fell on rocky ground did not have enough soil for its roots, so it withered and died  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to the seed that fell among the thorns?<<ANSWER>>: The thorns choked out the seed that fell among them so that it did not produce any grain  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to the seed that fell on the good soil?<<ANSWER>>: The seed that fell on the good soil produced 30, 60 or even 100 times as much grain as the seed that was planted  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What does the seed in the story represent?<<ANSWER>>: The seed in the story represents the word of God that goes out to different people  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What does the seed on the path represent?<<ANSWER>>: The seed on the path represents people who do not understand the word of God. Then the devil takes it away from them  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What does the seed on the rocky ground represent?<<ANSWER>>: The seed on the rocky ground represents people who hear the word of God, but then hardship causes them to stop trusting in God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What does the seed on the thorny ground represent?<<ANSWER>>: The seed on the thorny ground represents people who allow money and other things to distract them from their love for God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What does the seed in the good soil represent?<<ANSWER>>: The seed in the good soil is the person who hears and believes the word of God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think Jesus told this story to the large crowd?<<ANSWER>>: There would be many kinds of people in the large crowd. They would respond to the words of Jesus in different ways. This story described how they would respond. They would all hear the words of Jesus, but only a few would believe his words and do what God wanted them to do. The other people would fail to love God for different reasons.|||<<QUESTION>>: How can hardship and suffering cause a person to stop trusting in God?<<ANSWER>>: Many people wrongly think that God will only allow good things to happen to them. Therefore, when they suffer, they think that God has deceived them or that he does not care about them. They stop trusting in him and following him. But God promised that people would treat his disciples badly. |||<<QUESTION>>: How do worries about money and other things cause people to stop loving God?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus said that people cannot love both God and money. They must choose to serve either God or possessions. Many people try do both, but they cannot. If they do not stop loving their possessions, they stop loving God. God is not pleased with these people.|||<<QUESTION>>: How does a person produce 30, 60 or 100 times as much fruit?<<ANSWER>>: A single person can cause many other people to hear about Jesus and to love God. This may not happen all at once. But if they obey God throughout their lives and tell others about him, many people will respond to their testimony. The people may be their family, their friends, or even total strangers. |||

Summary: God created everything that exists. He simply spoke, and the entire universe appeared out of nothing. However, God formed the first man and woman in a more personal way. He breathed life into the man, and then formed the woman from the man. God wanted people to be like him in ways that animals are not. God finished his work in six days, and set the seventh day apart as a time for people to remember how he had made everything.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What all did God create?<<ANSWER>>: God made the universe and everything in it. He made light. He made the sun, moon, and stars. He made the earth with its sea and dry land. He made all the plants, birds, and animals. And he made the first man and woman, and a made a garden where they could live. |||<<QUESTION>>: What did God do in order to create everything except the first people?<<ANSWER>>: God only spoke, and the universe and everything in it appeared. In that way, he showed his great power. |||<<QUESTION>>: In what way did God decide to make people to be different than the animals?<<ANSWER>>: God decided to make people in God’s image and to be like him. He also decided to give them power over all of the earth and over the animals  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What two special trees did God plant in the garden?<<ANSWER>>: God planted many trees in the garden, but he also planted two special trees. He planted the tree of life in the garden and told Adam that he could eat its fruit. He also planted the tree of the knowledge of good and evil there and told Adam he would die if he ate fruit from that tree  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did God do so that the man would not be alone?<<ANSWER>>: God wanted Adam to have a helper who would be like Adam. But none of the animals were like Adam, so they could not be his helper. Therefore, God took one of Adam’s ribs and made the woman from it to be a helper for Adam  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did God do after he finished making everything?<<ANSWER>>: After God finished making everything in six days, he rested on the seventh day. God was not tired, but he had finished his work of making everything. He blessed the seventh day and made it a special day  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think God made the man and the woman in a different way than he made the universe and the other things in the earth?<<ANSWER>>: God creates people in a more personal way than he created everything else. He formed the man from dust and breathed life into him. Then God formed the woman from one of the man’s ribs. In this way, he showed that people were very important to him, and that they have a special purpose in creation  . |||<<QUESTION>>: In what way are people like God and made in his image? How are they different than God?<<ANSWER>>: God made people to be like God, but not the same as God. That is, people have some of the characteristics of God that the animals do not have. However, people are not equal to God. They are in God’s image because they are like God in some ways  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think God put the tree of the knowledge of good and evil in the garden when he did not want Adam to eat its fruit?<<ANSWER>>: God wanted Adam to be able to choose whether or not to obey God. Therefore, God planted the tree of the knowledge of good and evil in the garden where Adam was. However, he warned Adam clearly that he would die if he ate fruit from that tree. And God allowed Adam to eat fruit from every other tree, so there was no reason for Adam to disobey God  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think God made the woman from the man rather than from the soil?<<ANSWER>>: God wanted the man and the woman to become one. Therefore, he did not make the woman separately from Adam. Instead, God took part of Adam and made her from that. When Adam saw her, he understood that she was very much like Adam, and that God had made her especially for him  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How do you think a man becomes one with his wife?<<ANSWER>>: God wants a man and his wife to have a special bond that is closer than their connection to any other person. It is even closer than the bond with their parents. As they grow to know each other more, they begin to think in similar ways and value the same things. People who have been married a long time often seem to know what each other is thinking without even speaking  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God say that everything he had made was very good?<<ANSWER>>: God created everything so that everything would work together to accomplish what he wanted to happen  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did God want people to do on the seventh day?<<ANSWER>>: God made the seventh day a special day. On that day, he wanted people to stop doing their normal work. Instead, they should remember that God created them and everything around them. Because they would not work on the seventh day, they would have more time to honor God and think about him than they did on the other days of the week  . |||

Summary: God did not send the Messiah in the way that people usually arrive in the world. God did a miracle so that John could be born to elderly parents and prepare the way for the Messiah. Then God caused the Messiah to be born of a virgin so he would be without sin. The Messiah did not have a human father—he was the Son of God! There has never been anyone like him in the world.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: How many years went by when God did not speak to his people through a prophet?<<ANSWER>>: God did not speak to his people through a prophet for 400 years  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What problem did Zechariah and Elizabeth have?<<ANSWER>>: They were very old, and Elizabeth had not been able to have children  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What would John get the people ready to do?<<ANSWER>>: John would get the people ready to accept the Messiah  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Zechariah become unable to speak?<<ANSWER>>: Zechariah became unable to speak because he did not believe the angel when the angel said Zechariah would have a son  . |||<<QUESTION>>: To whom was Mary engaged to be married?<<ANSWER>>: Mary was engaged to be married to a man named Joseph  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Who did the angel tell Mary that her son would be?<<ANSWER>>: The angel said she should name her son Jesus, and he would be the Son of the Most High God who would rule forever  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why was Mary confused about how she could have a son?<<ANSWER>>: Mary was a virgin. Therefore, she did not understand how she could have a son  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did Mary respond when the angel told her that God and the Holy Spirit would come to her so that she would be pregnant?<<ANSWER>>: Mary believed that what the angel said would happen to her  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Elizabeth’s baby do when Mary arrived to visit Elizabeth?<<ANSWER>>: Elizabeth’s baby jumped inside her when Mary arrived to visit  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Zechariah and Elizabeth name their baby John?<<ANSWER>>: The angel has commanded them to name their baby John. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why were Zechariah and Elizabeth unable to have children before this time?<<ANSWER>>: Zechariah and Elizabeth were unable to have children, but this did not mean that they had done anything wrong. They honored God, and he was pleased with them. Therefore, God did a miracle through them, allowing them to become the parents of John in their old age.|||<<QUESTION>>: Was Zechariah being reasonable when he doubted the message of the angel?<<ANSWER>>: It would certainly seem reasonable that Zechariah doubted the angel, because God had not spoken to his people for 400 years. However, God did not merely send a prophet to Zechariah. Instead, he sent one of his mighty angels. The presence of the angel should have convinced Zechariah to believe the message.|||<<QUESTION>>: Mary was a virgin. Therefore, her son did not have a human father. Why do you think this was important?<<ANSWER>>: Every descendant of Adam and Eve is born with a desire to sin. Mary’s son, however, is the Son of God, conceived by the Holy Spirit. For that reason, he is holy and has never sinned. He is the only person who has ever been born who does not have this desire to sin. God did not need to punish him for his sins. Instead, he could be punished in the place of other people who sinned. |||<<QUESTION>>: How was baby John able to know when Mary came to Elizabeth, and to jump in Elizabeth’s womb?<<ANSWER>>: John was already a person who could think and act even while he was in Elizabeth’s womb. He was already able to worship God by jumping inside Elizabeth when Mary came near with the baby Son of God inside her. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God send John ahead of the Messiah?<<ANSWER>>: The Messiah is the most important person who ever came to earth. When important people traveled somewhere in that time, someone went ahead of them to make preparations for their arrival and to tell people that they were coming. This is what John did for the Messiah. He told them that the Messiah was coming, and prepared people to accept him.|||

Summary: Jesus took only his closest disciples—Peter, James, and John—up the mountain with him. He then allowed them to see him briefly change to his divine appearance and talk with Moses and Elijah about his coming death. The disciples were not yet able to understand what these things meant. But after the death and resurrection of Jesus, they would understand that Jesus was the Messiah and the Son of God. They would then be able to explain to other people that God sent his Son Jesus as the Messiah to pay the penalty for the sins of other people.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Who did Jesus take with him when he went up the mountain to pray?<<ANSWER>>: He took Peter, James, and John  .|||<<QUESTION>>: In what way did Jesus’ face change as he was praying?<<ANSWER>>: His face became as bright as the sun  .|||<<QUESTION>>: In what way did Jesus’ clothes change as he was praying?<<ANSWER>>: His clothes became as white as light, whiter than anyone on earth could make them  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who appeared with Jesus on the mountain?<<ANSWER>>: Moses and the prophet Elijah appeared with him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What were Jesus, Moses, and Elijah talking about?<<ANSWER>>: They were talking about Jesus’ death, which would soon happen in Jerusalem  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Peter offer to do for Jesus, Moses, and Elijah?<<ANSWER>>: Peter offered to build three shelters for them  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who answered Peter?<<ANSWER>>: God the Father answered as a voice from heaven  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God the Father tell Peter do to?<<ANSWER>>: God said that Peter should listen to Jesus, because he was God’s Son whom he loved, and God was pleased with him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the disciples do when they heard God’s voice?<<ANSWER>>: The disciples fell down on the ground in fear  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the disciples see when Jesus told them to get up?<<ANSWER>>: They no longer saw anyone there except Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: When would Jesus allow the disciples to tell people what had happened on the mountain?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus told the disciples that after he would die and come back to life, they could then tell people what had happened on the mountain  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think Jesus took only Peter, James, and John with him up the mountain, and not the other disciples?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus allowed Peter, James, and John to see and hear more things than the other disciples. This may have been because they would become the highest leaders of the early church.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the appearance of Jesus changed?<<ANSWER>>: While Jesus was on earth, he appeared as a normal person. However, he was also God. On the mountain, he allowed the disciples to see a glimpse of his divine nature. Both his face and his clothes changed to the form they have in heaven.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why is it significant that Moses and Elijah were the two men who were talking with Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Moses represents all the law of God, and Elijah represents all the Old Testament prophets who prophesied that the Messiah would come and die in order to save people. When they appeared with Jesus, that showed that Jesus was the Messiah.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why was it not proper for Peter to make shelters for Jesus, Moses, and Elijah?<<ANSWER>>: Peter wanted to make three shelters in order to honor Jesus, Moses, and Elijah as equals. But they were not equal. Jesus was the Messiah and the Son of God. He was greater than Moses and Elijah. Therefore, God the Father spoke from heaven and told Peter to listen only to Jesus. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think Jesus did not allow the disciples to tell anyone what had happened on the mountain right away?<<ANSWER>>: The disciples did not yet understand what these thing meant. They would not be able to explain them properly at that time. However, after Jesus would die and come back to life again, they would understand these things, and could explain to other people what these things meant.|||

Summary: The story of the flood shows that God must punish people who sin against him. But he also wants to save people who honor him. Noah lived in a time when almost everyone was wicked. In spite of that, Noah honored God, and taught his family to honor him as well. Therefore, God made a way for Noah and his family to escape God’s punishment. Noah obeyed God. He built the boat and took his family into it. God then closed the door and protected them from the flood. After the flood, God told them to fill the earth again. Noah continued to honor God, and God promised never to destroy the earth with a flood again.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What did God decide to do about the wicked and violent people on the earth?<<ANSWER>>: He decided to destroy them with a huge flood  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How was Noah different than the other people?<<ANSWER>>: Noah was a righteous man even though he lived among wicked people  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What was the purpose of the boat that God told Noah to build?<<ANSWER>>: The boat would keep Noah and his family safe during the flood  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How many people entered into the boat?<<ANSWER>>: Eight people entered into the boat—Noah and his wife, and his three sons and their wives. No one else believed the flood would happen  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the animals come to the boat?<<ANSWER>>: God sent some of each kind of the animals to the boat  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How long did the rain last?<<ANSWER>>: The rain continued for 40 days and 40 nights  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to all the people and animals during the flood?<<ANSWER>>: Noah’s family and the animals that were inside the boat were safe. Every person and animal that was outside the boat died  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How long did the flood continue on the earth?<<ANSWER>>: The boat floated on the water for five months, it took three more months for the mountains to be visible  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What was the first thing Noah that did when he came out of the boat?<<ANSWER>>: Noah built and altar and sacrificed some of the animals to God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What promise did God make to Noah after the flood?<<ANSWER>>: God promised that he would not destroy the earth with a flood again. He put a rainbow in the sky as a sign of this promise  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God decide to destroy the world?<<ANSWER>>: God created people to be with him. But God is good and cannot accept things that are evil. Because almost all the people became wicked and disobeyed him, he decided to destroy all those evil people  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God save Noah and his family?<<ANSWER>>: God did not want to destroy all that he had made. Therefore, he chose to save Noah and his family because Noah was a righteous person who honored God. God would allow Noah’s descendants to fill the earth after the wicked people died.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why was no one else besides Noah’s family ready when the flood came?<<ANSWER>>: The boat was very large, and it took Noah and his sons a very long time to build it. Many other people would have seen Noah building the boat and would have asked him about it. But none of them believed God would destroy them, so none of them were ready when the flood came  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did other people not come into the boat when the rain began?<<ANSWER>>: God himself closed the door of the boat before the rain began. After God did that, it was too late for people to enter into the boat and be saved from the flood  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Noah build an altar and offer a sacrifice to God?<<ANSWER>>: Noah was a righteous man who honored God both before and after the flood. He knew that God had saved him and his family. Therefore, the first thing he did when he left the boat was to honor God with a sacrifice  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why is the rainbow important?<<ANSWER>>: The rainbow that appears after a rain reminds God and people of God’s promise. He said he will never destroy the earth again with a flood. |||

Summary: God sent his Son into the world to be human as well as divine. Jesus did many powerful miracles to prove he is the Son of God. Becoming human, he understood our weaknesses and struggles. Being divine, he is able to save us from our sins and make us friends and children of God. He taught us about God and his kingdom, and showed us how to live as his followers. He made it possible for all people to repent of their sins. We can ask God to forgive us because Jesus died for us. God wants every person to hear this message, and to believe in Jesus.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: How did Mary become pregnant with Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: She was a virgin, but the Holy Spirit came to her and made her become pregnant  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus say was better than anything else in the world?<<ANSWER>>: He said to be in the kingdom of God was better than anything else in the world  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who did Jesus say were like good soil?<<ANSWER>>: People who receive the good news about Jesus are like good soil, and God will save them  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What does God want to do for sinners because he loves them very much?<<ANSWER>>: He wants to forgive them and to make them his children  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did God show that he loves everyone in the world?<<ANSWER>>: He gave his only Son to receive the punishment due to sinners so that those who believe in him will escape the punishment and live with him forever  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How is Jesus the perfect sacrifice to take away your sins?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus never sinned, but he took the place of all sinners, receiving the punishment for sin  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What do you need to do in order to become a follower of Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: If you believe in Jesus and confess what he has done for you, you are a follower of Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Does Satan tempt followers of Jesus to sin?<<ANSWER>>: Yes, Satan will still tempt followers of Jesus to sin. But if you confess your sins, God will forgive you  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How can you become a strong friend of Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: You will be a strong friend of Jesus if you pray and study his word, worship together with other followers of Jesus, and tell other people what Jesus has done for you  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why is it important to us that Jesus is human as well as God?<<ANSWER>>: Because Jesus is human as well as divine he can understand our struggles and weaknesses and will help us to serve God.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why can we be confident that Jesus is God?<<ANSWER>>: He did many powerful miracles for many people that proved he was God. He walked on water, calmed storms, healed sick people, drove out demons, and even raised dead people to life. If he were only a man, he would not have been able to do these things.|||<<QUESTION>>: How can you know that you will be in God’s kingdom?<<ANSWER>>: If you believe in Jesus and ask him to forgive your sins, God will save you and invite you into his kingdom.|||<<QUESTION>>: What kind of soil are you—good soil, or hard soil on a path?<<ANSWER>>: Only you can answer that question.|||<<QUESTION>>: Have you become a friend of God and a child of God, or are you still an enemy of God?<<ANSWER>>: Only you can answer that question.|||<<QUESTION>>: Will you pay for your own sins against God, or have you asked Jesus to pay for your sins?<<ANSWER>>: Only you can answer that question.|||<<QUESTION>>: What are you doing to become a strong friend of God?<<ANSWER>>: Only you can answer that question.|||

Story Title: Paul Becomes a follower of Jesus
Summary: As the Jews continued to persecute the believers, God did an amazing thing. He chose to set apart Saul, one of the worst persecutors of the church, and cause him to preach boldly about Jesus! He appeared to Saul on the road in blazing light, rebuked him, and made Saul blind. As a result, Saul believed in Jesus and began to boldly proclaim his name. When the Jews drove him out of Damascus, he went to Jerusalem and continued to preach there. Later, he went with Barnabas to Antioch and taught the first believers who were not Jews. And finally, God told the church at Antioch to send out Barnabas and Saul to preach to other people groups everywhere. God continued to spread the message of Jesus.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What did Saul do to the believers in Jerusalem?<<ANSWER>>: He persecuted them by going from house to house to arrest both men and women and put them in prison  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Saul go to the city of Damascus?<<ANSWER>>: The high priest gave Saul permission to go to Damascus to arrest the followers of Jesus there and bring them back to Jerusalem  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to Saul as he was traveling to Damascus?<<ANSWER>>: A bright light shone around him and he heard someone say, “Saul! Saul! Why are you persecuting me?”  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who did God send to Saul so that he could see again?<<ANSWER>>: God sent a disciple in Damascus named Ananias to Saul to make him see again  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who did Saul tell the Jews in Damascus that Jesus was?<<ANSWER>>: Saul told them that Jesus was the Son of God and the Messiah  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Saul escape from the Jews in Damascus when they wanted to kill him?<<ANSWER>>: Saul’s friends lowered him over the city wall in a basket at night so he could escape  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened when Saul tried to meet with the apostles in Jerusalem?<<ANSWER>>: The apostles were afraid of Saul until Barnabas took him to them and explained how Saul had boldly preached about Jesus in Damascus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How were the believers in Antioch different from the believers in Jerusalem?<<ANSWER>>: The believers in Antioch were not Jews  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who did the Holy Spirit tell the followers of Jesus in Antioch to set apart to do God’s work in other places?<<ANSWER>>: The Holy Spirit told them to set apart Barnabas and Saul to do God’s work, so they sent them out  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What was Saul’s attitude about the believers before the Lord appeared to him?<<ANSWER>>: Saul hated the believers and tried to destroy them. He guarded the robes of the people who killed Stephen. Later, he arrested believers throughout Jerusalem, and planned to do the same thing in Damascus. He was perhaps the least likely person we would expect God to save and use for his glory.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think Jesus told Saul that he was persecuting Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus was already in heaven when Saul began to persecute the believers. But the believers represented Jesus on earth, so when Saul persecuted them, it was as if he was persecuting Jesus himself. Jesus cares about what happens to the believers.|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God tell Ananias that he had chosen Saul to do?<<ANSWER>>: God told Ananias that he had chosen Saul to declare his name to the Jews and to people from other people groups, and to suffer in God’s name. Even though Saul had hated the believers and persecuted them, God had a plan to use Saul to spread the good news about Jesus throughout the world of that day.|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened in Damascus when Saul preached about Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Saul argued boldly with the Jews to prove that Jesus was the Son of God. However, it is not clear if many people believed. Perhaps arguing about Jesus is not the best way to convince people to repent of their sin. After a time, the Jews tried to kill Saul, and he had to escape at night.|||<<QUESTION>>: Who went to Antioch to teach the new believers there?<<ANSWER>>: The two people who went to teach the believers at Antioch were Barnabas and Saul. Saul was the one who God said he would send to people of other nations, such as the people at Antioch. And Barnabas was the one who spoke for Saul and convinced the apostles in Jerusalem to accept him. Both men were uniquely prepared to teach people who were not Jews.|||<<QUESTION>>: How did the Holy Spirit send out Barnabas and Saul?<<ANSWER>>: The Holy Spirit spoke to the believers in the church at Antioch in order to send out Barnabas and Saul. The church then prayed for them, placed their hands on them, and supported them as they went out to preach among the other people groups. God did not send them out alone. Instead, he worked through the church so the believers were deeply involved in the work of Barnabas and Saul.|||

Summary: The rich young ruler who came to Jesus genuinely wanted to receive eternal life. He thought that he had obeyed God enough to be worthy of eternal life. Jesus loved him, but also knew that the young man loved his possessions. Therefore, Jesus tested him by telling him to give up his possessions and to follow Jesus in order to have eternal life. However, this made the young man very sad. The disciples were surprised that Jesus did not accept the rich young man. But Jesus explained that he would reward the disciples who gave up their wealth for his sake.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What did the rich young ruler want Jesus to tell him?<<ANSWER>>: The rich young ruler wanted Jesus to tell him how he could have eternal life. He wanted to live forever with God  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did Jesus respond when the man called him **good**?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus asked the young man what he meant to say when he called Jesus **good**. Jesus did not wait for the man to answer. He reminded the man that only God is truly good. Perhaps Jesus was asking the man if he believed that Jesus was God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus tell the young man he should do in order to have eternal life?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus told him to obey God’s laws in order to have eternal life  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How well did the young man think he had obeyed the law?<<ANSWER>>: The young man thought he had always fully obeyed God’s law. Of course, no one can do that. But he honestly believed that he had done everything that God asked him to do  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus tell the young man to give up?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus told the young man to give up all of his possessions  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus tell the young man to do after he gave up his possessions?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus told the young man to follow him as his disciple  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the young man go away sad?<<ANSWER>>: The young man went away sad because he had many possessions, and he did not want to give them up  .|||<<QUESTION>>: According to Jesus, how do riches affect whether a person enters heaven?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus said that it was almost impossible for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of heaven  .|||<<QUESTION>>: If disciples give up things for Jesus’ sake, how much more will they receive from him?<<ANSWER>>: Disciples who give up things for Jesus will receive 100 times as much from him as a reward  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the young man ask which laws he must obey?<<ANSWER>>: The young man did not understand that people must obey all of God’s laws. God considers that we sin if we fail to obey even one of his laws. The young man wrongly thought that God would accept him if he faithfully obeyed some of God’s most important laws.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus talk to the young man about being perfect?<<ANSWER>>: The young man wrongly thought he could be ***good enough*** to have eternal life. Jesus wanted him to know that he had to be perfect—that is, without any sin—in order to have eternal life. He could not keep God’s law perfectly. The only way for him to be perfect was to follow Jesus and trust that Jesus would save him from his sin.|||<<QUESTION>>: If the young man wanted to have eternal life, why was he not willing to give up his possessions?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus promised that the young man would have treasure in heaven if he followed Jesus. However, the young man could not yet see and touch that treasure. He had to believe that Jesus would reward him. However, he could easily see and touch the possessions that he already had in this world. Therefore, it was hard for him to give up his current treasure to gain something that he could not yet see. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why were the disciples so shocked to hear that it was almost impossible for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven?<<ANSWER>>: The people of that day believed that if God loved someone, he made them wealthy. The more possessions a person had, the more people thought God loved them. The disciples were shocked to hear that God does not necessarily accept a person who is rich.|||<<QUESTION>>: When will Jesus reward his disciples for giving up things for his sake?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus does not say when he will reward his disciples. He may give them some things in this life, but most of their reward will be in heaven. Jesus clearly told his disciples that he would give them 100 times as much as they give up for him in this life. Other people may think they are poor in this life, but Jesus will richly reward them in his kingdom.|||

Summary: God and the people did not change. The people always disobeyed God and worshiped idols. And God always punished them when they sinned and rescued them when they repented of their sin. This pattern happened to the Israelites many times. With great power, God helped Gideon to rescue them from the Midianites. But after that, they worshiped idols again. They would not obey God. They did not want God to be their king. Instead, they finally asked God to give them a king so they could be just like the other nations who worshiped idols.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: How did the Israelites disobey God?<<ANSWER>>: They did not keep his laws, and they did not drive out the rest of the Canaanites from the land. Also, they began to worship Canaanite gods  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What pattern did the Israelites keep repeating?<<ANSWER>>: They would disobey God, so he would punish them by allowing their enemies to defeat them. Does this mean they obeyed God?<<ANSWER>>: The Israelites did not think about God in the right way. Therefore, they thought it was right to worship idols even though God had told them to worship only him. This happened many times.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did it take so long for the Israelites to ask God to save them from the Midianites?<<ANSWER>>: The Midianites stole all of the Israelites’ crops for seven years before they asked God to save them. Perhaps they forgot that he could rescue them. Or perhaps they asked their idols to save them for seven years before they finally decided to ask God for help.|||<<QUESTION>>: What are some of the ways that Gideon showed that he was not very brave?<<ANSWER>>: Gideon was hiding from the Midianites as he threshed grain. He tore down his father’s altar at night because he was afraid of the people. God had to show him two signs to convince him to attack the Midianites. And God sent him to the Midianite camp to hear a soldier talk about his dream so Gideon would not be afraid. In spite of his fear, God used him to save Israel.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God make Gideon send home all but 300 soldiers?<<ANSWER>>: God wanted everyone to know that the Israelites defeated the Midianites because God helped them. He did not want them to think their own strength saved them. For that reason, he did not want Gideon to attack with a lot of soldiers. |||<<QUESTION>>: Were the people thankful that God send deliverers to rescue them from their enemies?<<ANSWER>>: The people were not happy that God only sent them deliverers. Instead, they wanted a king like all the other nations had. |||

Story Title: Jesus Heals a Demon-Possessed Man & a Sick Woman
Summary: Jesus healed two people who were suffering greatly. The man had a demon that no one could control or remove. The woman was bleeding and no doctor could heal her. Jesus had the power to easily heal them both. However, he did not heal either person in secret. He sent the demons from the man into the pigs so that they died. As a result, everyone in the region heard that he had healed the man. Furthermore, he told the man who was healed to go home and to continue to tell everyone there what Jesus had done for him. Likewise, Jesus did not allow the woman to be healed in secret. He called her out before the crowd so that she could tell them all how Jesus had healed her. Jesus was preparing people to be able to tell everyone who he was and what he had done for them.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: How did the demon affect the man he possessed?<<ANSWER>>: The demon made the man so strong that no one could control him. But it also made him scream all day and night, go around without clothes, and cut himself with stones  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What was the name of the demon in the man?<<ANSWER>>: The name of the demon was Legion because he was actually a group of many demons  .|||<<QUESTION>>: The demons asked Jesus for permission to do what?<<ANSWER>>: The demons asked Jesus for permission to go into the pigs instead of leaving the region  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened when the demons entered into the pigs?<<ANSWER>>: All 2,000 pigs ran into the lake and drowned  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the people of the region ask Jesus to do when they saw the man who was healed and heard that the pigs were dead?<<ANSWER>>: Because the people of the region were afraid of Jesus, they asked him to leave them  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What problem did the woman in the crowd have?<<ANSWER>>: The woman had been bleeding for 12 years. She spent all of her money on doctors and none of them could heal her. Instead, she got worse  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the woman think would heal her?<<ANSWER>>: The woman thought she would be healed if she could only touch Jesus’ clothes  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened when the woman touched Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: The woman immediately stopped bleeding when she touched Jesus. But Jesus knew that power had gone out from him, and asked who had touched him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus say was the reason the woman was healed?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus told the woman that her faith had healed her. She was well because she believed that Jesus could heal her  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did the demons treat the man they possessed?<<ANSWER>>: The demons caused the man they possessed to suffer and to bring shame upon himself. They caused him to harm even his own body. He would scream in pain all day and all night. Demons want to destroy the people whom God created.|||<<QUESTION>>: This story show that Jesus had which power over the demons?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus had the power to command the demons to come out of the man. He also had the power to decide where they could go after they left him. Jesus could send them into eternal punishment. The demons were afraid Jesus would do that. That is why they asked to go into the pigs instead.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the people ask Jesus to leave their region?<<ANSWER>>: The people were very concerned about the money they lost when their pigs drowned, but they did not care that the man was released from the demons. They asked Jesus to leave because they valued their possessions more than they valued other people.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus tell the man who was freed from the demons to go to his home?<<ANSWER>>: The man wanted to follow Jesus as his disciple. But Jesus told the man to stay and to be his disciple among his own people. The people sent Jesus away. So Jesus told the man to stay at his home so that he could tell the people there about Jesus after Jesus went away.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus ask the woman to tell what had happened to her?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus healed the woman because she believed in him. But Jesus also wanted other people to believe in him. For that reason, he did not allow the woman to be healed in secret. Instead, he caused her to tell everyone how he had healed her. In this way, she acted as his disciple.|||

Summary: God provided everything Adam and Eve needed in the garden. The fruit of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil was the only thing they could not have. The snake convinced Eve that God did not want them to be wise, and that was why God told them not to eat the fruit. So Adam and Eve disobeyed God and sinned by eating the fruit. They immediately were ashamed and hid from God. God cursed Adam, Eve, and the snake because of what they had done. Then God drove them out of the garden so they would not eat the fruit of the tree of life and live forever as sinners. But God also promised him that a descendant of the woman would later come and kill the snake.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What did Adam and Eve need that they did not have in the garden?<<ANSWER>>: Adam and Eve had everything they needed in the garden. There was no sin or shame, and they were able to walk with God and speak directly to him  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did the snake convince the woman to eat the fruit of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil?<<ANSWER>>: The snake first questioned what God said  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the woman eat the fruit?<<ANSWER>>: Eve thought the fruit looked good, and she wanted to be wise like God. Therefore, she decided to disobey God and to eat the fruit. |||<<QUESTION>>: What did Adam and Eve do after they ate the fruit?<<ANSWER>>: They were both ashamed, and tried to cover themselves with leaves. Then they tried to hide from God  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What answer did Adam give when God asked if he had eaten the fruit?<<ANSWER>>: Adam did not admit that he had sinned. Instead, he blamed his wife. |||<<QUESTION>>: What answer did Eve give when God asked her what she had done?<<ANSWER>>: Eve did not admit that she had sinned. Instead, she blamed the snake. |||<<QUESTION>>: What would the snake do to Eve’s descendant, and what would he do to the snake?<<ANSWER>>: Eve’s descendant would kill the snake by crushing its head. The snake would wound Eve’s descendant by biting him on the heel of his foot. |||<<QUESTION>>: What did God use to cover Adam and Eve?<<ANSWER>>: God covered them with animal skins. Most scholars think this was the first animal sacrifice. God killed the animals and took their skins to cover Adam and Eve. |||<<QUESTION>>: What did God want to say when he said that Adam’s body would return to the soil?<<ANSWER>>: God made Adam from the soil  . When he died, he would become soil once again. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God send Adam and Eve out of the garden?<<ANSWER>>: God did not want them to eat from the tree of life in the garden and live forever as sinners. |||<<QUESTION>>: How did the snake convince Eve to eat the fruit?<<ANSWER>>: The snake did not begin by telling Eve to disobey God. Instead, he asked questions that caused Eve to think about the one fruit that God had told her not to eat. Then the snake convinced her that God did not do the right thing when he told her not to eat the fruit. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think Eve forgot about all the things God had given her, and only focused on the one fruit that God told her not to eat?<<ANSWER>>: People often do not like someone telling them not to do something. They want to do whatever they want to do. Eve did not care that it was God who told her not to eat the fruit, or that God told her not to eat it in order to protect her. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think Adam and Eve tried to cover their shame and hid from God?<<ANSWER>>: When they disobeyed God by eating the fruit, they became sinners. They were so ashamed that they did not want God to see them. |||<<QUESTION>>: How did Adam and Eve answer God when he asked them what they had done?<<ANSWER>>: Adam and Eve both blamed someone else for what they had done. Adam blamed Eve, and Eve blamed the snake. Neither of them was willing to tell God the truth about what they did. |||<<QUESTION>>: How did the curses match the way that Adam, Eve, and the snake disobeyed God?<<ANSWER>>: Adam ate the fruit, so God made it difficult for him to grow food. Eve caused Adam to sin, so God gave Adam power over Eve. The snake spoke as if he were wiser than God, so God made him crawl on his belly. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why was it bad for Adam and Eve to know good and evil?<<ANSWER>>: Their knowledge of good and evil was knowledge gained by personal experience. That experience of making an evil choice caused them to be separated from God. Their fellowship with him was broken  . |||

Summary: Jesus knew that the Passover meal represented the way Jesus would suffer and die for sinners. He explained this to his disciples, but they did not understand him or believe that he would die. None of the disciples prayed or prepared for the time when Jesus would be betrayed. Even worse, his own disciple, Judas, betrayed him. Then the other disciples ran away. However, this did not surprise Jesus. He knew they would leave him and that he would die. That was the reason for which he came into the world.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What does the Passover celebrate?<<ANSWER>>: It celebrates how God saved the Jews from slavery in Egypt  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus tell the disciples would happen to him in Jerusalem after the Passover?<<ANSWER>>: He told them that he would be killed there  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Judas offer to do for the Jewish leaders in exchange for money?<<ANSWER>>: He offered to betray Jesus to them so they could kill Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus say the bread he broke represented?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus said the bread was his body, which he would give for the disciples  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus say the cup of wine he drank represented?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus said the cup of wine was the New Covenant in his blood, which he would pour out for the disciples  .|||<<QUESTION>>: As Jesus and the disciples walked to the Mount of Olives, what did Jesus say the disciples would all do that night?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus said the disciples would all abandon him, like sheep scattering when their shepherd is struck  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus say that Peter would do before the rooster crowed that night?<<ANSWER>>: He said Peter would deny three times that he even knew Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus ask his Father to do when he prayed in the garden?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus asked his Father not to make him drink the cup of suffering. But he also asked his Father to do his will even if there was no other way except for Jesus to die  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the disciples do instead of watching with Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: They fell asleep, because they were very tired  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Judas betray Jesus to the crowd?<<ANSWER>>: He pretended to honor Jesus by greeting him with a kiss  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus do for the servant of the high priest?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus healed the servant after Peter cut off his ear with a sword  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the disciples not suspect that Judas would betray Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Judas appeared to be just like the other disciples. In fact, they trusted him so much that they put him in charge of their shared money bag. Judas fooled all of the disciples. Jesus alone knew that he would betray Jesus.|||<<QUESTION>>: What new meaning did Jesus reveal about the Passover meal?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus said the bread and the cup of wine at the Passover meal would remind the disciples that Jesus gave his body and shed his blood in order to save them.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the disciples did not believe that they would abandon Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: The disciples thought they were brave enough to stand with Jesus. They were offended when he warned them that they would flee. Therefore, they fell asleep instead of watching and praying as Jesus had asked them. As a result, they were not able to stand with him when Judas and the crowd came for Jesus.|||<<QUESTION>>: What does Jesus prayer to his Father in the garden teach us about doing God’s will?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus did not want to suffer and die, and asked his Father to spare him. However, Jesus was also willing to suffer in order to do his Father’s will. He knew that there was no other way for sinners to be saved if he did not die for them. Therefore, he was willing to be arrested and killed.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the Jewish leaders need Judas to betray Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus taught publicly every day, but the Jewish leaders were afraid to arrest him in front of the crowds who came to listen to him. They needed Judas to tell them when Jesus would be in a secluded place so they could arrest him in secret.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think Peter struck the servant of the high priest with his sword?<<ANSWER>>: Peter did not understand that Jesus must die for sinners. He had not listened each time Jesus told him this would happen. Therefore, he wrongly tried to save Jesus by force. But Jesus rebuked Peter and even healed the servant that Peter struck. He did not want his servants to prevent his arrest.|||

Summary: Paul never forgot that God saved him from persecuting the believers and enabled him to proclaim the message about Jesus to people in many different people groups. Because God was so gracious to him, Paul was willing to go anywhere for God, and to praise him even when he was suffering. As a result, God used Paul powerfully to preach to people in many cities throughout the world. In addition, Paul wrote many letters to believers in different cities to teach and encourage them. Many of these letters became books of the Bible and continue to teach and encourage us today. Therefore, Pauls’ ministry extended to places he never visited, and continues long after his death, even to today.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Who was Paul?<<ANSWER>>: **Paul** was Saul using his Roman name as he traveled through the Roman Empire  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Where did Paul and Silas meet Lydia?<<ANSWER>>: Paul and Silas met Lydia in Philippi when they went to a place by the river outside the city where people gathered to pray  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the demon enable the slave girl to do for her masters?<<ANSWER>>: The demon enabled her to predict the future for people. They paid her masters a lot of money for that  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why was Paul annoyed with the slave girl?<<ANSWER>>: The demon caused her to keep telling people that Paul and Silas were servants of the Most High God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the owners of the slave girl do when Paul forced the demon to leave her?<<ANSWER>>: They became very angry with Paul and Silas, for they realized the girl could no longer tell the future, and people would no longer pay them. So they took Paul and Silas to the authorities, who beat them and put them into jail  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened when the earthquake shook the jail during the night?<<ANSWER>>: All the prison doors opened wide, and the chains of all the prisoners fell off. As a result, the jailer thought the prisoners had escaped, and planned to kill himself  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the jailer ask Paul and Silas when they stopped him from killing himself?<<ANSWER>>: The jailer asked them what he must do in order to be saved  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Paul and Silas baptize the jailer and his whole family?<<ANSWER>>: Paul and Silas baptized them because they all believed in Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Paul do after he and Silas were released from jail in Philippi?<<ANSWER>>: Paul traveled to many cities to preach the good news about Jesus. He also wrote many letters to teach and encourage the believers in the churches. Some of his letters became books of the Bible  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Paul and Silas go to the river in Philippi?<<ANSWER>>: When Paul and Silas arrived in Philippi, they looked for a place where people would be willing to hear about Jesus. They went to the river because that was the place where people went to pray to God.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Lydia need to believe in Jesus if she already loved and worshiped God?<<ANSWER>>: Lydia perhaps followed the Jewish religion. She knew about God, but she did not know about Jesus. When Paul and Silas told her about Jesus, she believed in him and was baptized. It is not enough for a person to believe in God. They must also believe in Jesus, whom God sent, in order to be saved from their sins.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why was Paul so annoyed by the demon that was speaking the truth about Paul and Silas?<<ANSWER>>: Demons are evil, and the enemies of God. Therefore, Paul was not willing to have them speak about God—even if what they said at that time was true. There can be no friendship between demons and the servants of God.|||<<QUESTION>>: What were Paul and Silas doing in the middle of the night while they were in jail?<<ANSWER>>: Even though the authorities beat Paul and Silas and threw them into jail, they were singing songs of praise to God. They trusted God completely, and were able to praise him in the most difficult situations.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Paul stop the jailer from killing himself?<<ANSWER>>: Paul had mercy on the jailer. Because he thought the prisoners had escaped, the jailer was so afraid that he planned to kill himself. But Paul and Silas remained in the prison instead of escaping so that they could tell the jailer about Jesus. As a result, the jailer and his whole family believed.|||<<QUESTION>>: To whom did Paul write the letters that became books of the Bible?<<ANSWER>>: Paul wrote all of his letters to the believers in the churches of that time. However, the Holy Spirit guided Paul so that some of his books are also written to us today to encourage and teach us. Therefore, each book of the Bible has both an ancient and a modern audience. |||

Story Title: Jesus Raises Lazarus from the Dead
Summary: Jesus honored God with everything he did. He was not afraid of people who wanted to kill him. He was willing to allow Lazarus to die even though it made Martha, Mary, and Jesus himself very sad. The most important thing was to honor God. As a result, Martha, Mary, the disciples, and many others saw God work powerfully through Jesus to raise Lazarus to life again. This proved that Jesus was the Resurrection, the Life, the Messiah, and the Son of God. However, even these proofs did not stop the sinful religious leaders from hating Jesus and plotting to kill him.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus say would be the result of Lazarus being sick?<<ANSWER>>: He said that Lazarus’ illness would cause people to honor God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How long did Jesus wait before he went to see Lazarus?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus waited two days in the place where he was  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus mean when he said that Lazarus was sleeping?<<ANSWER>>: When Jesus said Lazarus was sleeping, he was using a polite way to say that Lazarus was dead  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How long had Lazarus been dead when Jesus finally arrived at his home?<<ANSWER>>: Lazarus had already been dead for four days by that time  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What title did Jesus give to himself when he spoke to Martha?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus said that he was the Resurrection and the Life  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who did Martha say that Jesus was?<<ANSWER>>: She said he was the Messiah, the Son of God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why was Martha afraid to open the tomb?<<ANSWER>>: She was afraid that the body of Lazarus would smell bad because he had been dead for four days  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus say to his Father was the reason that he was praying to his Father?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus said he was praying to his Father so that the people standing around would believe that God had sent Jesus into the world  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Lazarus do when Jesus told him to come out of the tomb?<<ANSWER>>: Lazarus became alive again and came out of the tomb, still wrapped in the grave clothes  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the religious leaders of the Jews plan to kill Jesus and Lazarus?<<ANSWER>>: They envied Jesus, because the people believed in him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think Jesus spoke about Lazarus’ death as if Lazarus were asleep?<<ANSWER>>: Lazarus had died, but he would not remain dead. Jesus knew that he would make Lazarus alive again. Jesus perhaps said Lazarus was asleep in order to show that his death was temporary. In the same way, God speaks of all believers who die as being asleep. This encourages followers of Jesus when a fellow believer dies. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus wait for two days before he went to Lazarus?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus did not want his friend Lazarus to suffer, or his sisters to grieve. But the most important thing to Jesus was to honor God. Therefore, Jesus allowed Lazarus, Martha, and Mary to suffer so that God would be honored when Jesus made Lazarus alive again. For followers of Jesus, suffering is temporary, and can bring glory to God.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why were the disciples surprised that Jesus wanted to go to Lazarus in Judea?<<ANSWER>>: The Jewish leaders in Judea wanted to kill Jesus.
