However, Jesus was not afraid to die. In fact, he came to earth in order to die for sinners. Therefore, he was willing to go to Judea even though he knew they wanted to kill him there.|||<<QUESTION>>: In what way was the faith of Martha and Mary limited?<<ANSWER>>: Martha and Mary both believed that Jesus was able to prevent Lazarus from dying. However, neither of them understood that Jesus could raise Lazarus to life even after he had died. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the religious leaders did not believe in Jesus even after he raised Lazarus from the dead?<<ANSWER>>: The religious leaders hated Jesus because people listened to Jesus instead of to them. They wanted power over people so badly that they would not even believe in him when he performed a miracle that only God can do. Their sin kept them from seeing that Jesus was God.|||

Story Title: Peter and John Heal a Beggar
Summary: Jesus has gone up to heaven, but he continued to give power to his disciples so they could do his work on earth. Jesus powerfully healed the crippled man through Peter so that many saw and believed Peter’s message. Jesus also enabled Peter and John to speak boldly to the Jewish leaders and to not be afraid of their threats. Instead, with great power, they continued to proclaim the message of Jesus to everyone. As a result, the church in Jerusalem continued to grow.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Why was the crippled man sitting at the gate of the Temple?<<ANSWER>>: He was begging for money from the people who were coming to the Temple  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Peter give the crippled man instead of money?<<ANSWER>>: Peter told him to get up and walk in the name of Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: According to Peter, whose power healed the crippled man?<<ANSWER>>: Peter said the man was not healed by the power of Peter and John, but by the power of Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Peter tell the people to do?<<ANSWER>>: He told them to repent and turn to God so that God would wash away their sins  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How many believers were there in Jerusalem after this message by Peter?<<ANSWER>>: The number of believers grew to about 5,000  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the Jewish leaders do to Peter and John after they healed the man?<<ANSWER>>: The leaders arrested them and brought them before the high priest and the other leaders  .|||<<QUESTION>>: According to Peter, what was the only way to be saved?<<ANSWER>>: Peter said there is no other way to be saved except through the power of Jesus Christ  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why were the leaders shocked that Peter and John spoke so boldly?<<ANSWER>>: Peter and John were ordinary, uneducated men. They should not have been able to speak so powerfully  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the leaders tell Peter and John before they let them go?<<ANSWER>>: The leaders threatened to punish them if they continued to speak to the people about Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the crippled man have to do in order to be healed?<<ANSWER>>: It appears that the crippled man did not have to do anything to be healed. We do not even know if he believed in Jesus before he was healed. Instead, Peter believed that Jesus would heal the man, and God healed him.|||<<QUESTION>>: How did the healing of the crippled man happen?<<ANSWER>>: The crippled man was immediately and completely healed. One minute, he could not stand, and the next minute, he was able to walk and jump around. The change was so obvious to everyone that the people who saw it were amazed and responded to Peter’s message.|||<<QUESTION>>: Who gave the power to heal the crippled man?<<ANSWER>>: Peter was very careful to tell the people that the power to heal the man did not come from Peter and John. Instead, Jesus healed the man because Peter and John believed in Jesus. Peter and John were very humble about the way God used them.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Peter tell the crowd that they killed Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: People cannot be saved if they do not repent. Therefore, Peter clearly explained how they had sinned by rejecting Jesus. Although they did not personally kill Jesus, they wanted Pilate to kill him, and so they were guilty of his death. They needed to confess that sin before God would save them, so Peter was not afraid to confront them.|||<<QUESTION>>: Is there any other way to be saved other than through Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Peter very clearly told the religious leaders that there is no other way to be saved except through Jesus. The works of the leaders would not save them. No other god could save them. Jesus is the only way.|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the leaders decide was the reason that Peter and John spoke so boldly?<<ANSWER>>: The leaders realized that they spoke so boldly because they had been with Jesus. It did not matter that they were not educated, and that they did not have important positions among their people. They followed Jesus and learned from him. Therefore, they were able to speak boldly and accurately for him.|||

Summary: God brought the people to the Promised Land, just as he said. But they were afraid of the Canaanites and refused to enter. Therefore, God made them wander for 40 years until all of the adults died. However, he cared for the people so that their children could enter the land. He kept his promise to Abraham. Moses saw the land, but could not enter because he had disobeyed God. Joshua became the leader of Israel after Moses died.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Why did God tell the people to get rid of the Canaanites completely?<<ANSWER>>: The Canaanites worshiped idols and did many evil things. God knew that if the Israelites lived with the Canaanites, they would marry them and start to worship idols also  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did ten of the spies say about the land and people of Canaan?<<ANSWER>>: They said the land was good, but that the people were giants. They said the Israelites could not defeat them  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Joshua and Caleb say about the people of Canaan?<<ANSWER>>: They said the people were indeed strong, but that God would fight for the Israelites so they could defeat the Canaanites  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did the people respond to the bad report of the ten spies?<<ANSWER>>: They were angry that they had left Egypt. They wanted to choose a new leader to replace Moses and Aaron and to lead them back to Egypt  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did God answer the people when they wanted to go back to Egypt?<<ANSWER>>: God was very angry with the people, and promised that they would wander in the wilderness until all the adults died. Only their children would enter into the Promised Land. Joshua and Caleb would also enter the land because they wanted to obey God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the people do when they heard that they would die in the wilderness?<<ANSWER>>: They attacked the Canaanites, but the Canaanites defeated them  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did God take care of the people in the wilderness?<<ANSWER>>: He gave them manna and quail to eat, and provided water for them. He also kept their clothes and sandals from wearing out for 40 years  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why could Moses not enter the Promised Land?<<ANSWER>>: God told Moses to speak to a rock so that it would give water to the people. But Moses disobeyed God and struck a rock with a stick instead. In this way, he dishonored God before the people. Therefore, God did not allow him to enter into the land. He went up to a high mountain and saw the land, and then he died  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What had the people of Canaan become like since Joseph and his family left?<<ANSWER>>: Joseph and his family had been in Egypt for 400 years. During that time, there was no one in Canaan who worshiped God. The people there had become very evil and worshiped many idols.|||<<QUESTION>>: What often happens to people who live among people that worship other gods?<<ANSWER>>: God said the Israelites would begin to worship the idols of the Canaanites if they lived with them. People normally begin to worship the gods of the people around them. This is especially true if they marry people who believe in other gods.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Joshua give the people different advice than the other ten spies?<<ANSWER>>: All 12 of the spies saw the same land and people. However, ten of the spies only thought about how hard it would be to defeat the people. But Joshua and Caleb thought about the good land and about how God would help them. They believed he would enable them to defeat the Canaanites even though they were tall and strong. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the people want to go back and be slaves in Egypt?<<ANSWER>>: The people were very afraid that the Canaanites would kill them. They thought it would be better to be enslaved in Egypt than to be killed. They did not trust God to protect them.|||<<QUESTION>>: God made the Israelites wander in the wilderness for 40 years until all the adults died. Why did he take such good care of them during that time?<<ANSWER>>: God was angry with the people who would not go into the Promised Land. But he kept his promise to Abraham to make his descendants into a great nation. Therefore, he continued to care for the Israelites in the wilderness, and for their children who would enter into the Promised Land after their parents would die.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God punish Moses so harshly for striking the rock?<<ANSWER>>: Moses was the leader of Israel. He spoke to them for God. Because everyone watched what Moses did, God punished him harshly so the people would be afraid to disobey God. For this reason, Moses was not allowed to enter the Promised Land.|||

Summary: Abraham wanted to make sure that his son Isaac married a woman who believed in God, and not a woman who served idols. Therefore, he sent his servant far away to the land of his relatives to find the right wife for Isaac. God directed Abraham’s servant to Rebekah, who trusted God. After Isaac married Rebekah, they could not have children. But God answered Isaac’s prayer and she became pregnant with twin boys. Even while they were in her womb, God told Rebekah that they would become two nations, and that the nation from the older son would obey the nation from the younger son. In this way, God chose to keep his covenant with Abraham through Isaac’s younger son, Jacob.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What did Abraham send his servant to do?<<ANSWER>>: Abraham sent him to get a wife for his son Isaac from among Abraham’s relatives  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Abraham’s servant choose Rebekah as a wife for Isaac?<<ANSWER>>: God led him to Rebekah  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did it seem as if Abraham would not have many descendants?<<ANSWER>>: Isaac’s wife, Rebekah, could not have children  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Isaac do when Rebekah could not have children?<<ANSWER>>: Isaac prayed to God, and God allowed her to get pregnant  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God tell Rebekah would happen to her two sons?<<ANSWER>>: God told her that her sons would become two nations who would struggle with each other. The nation from the older son would obey the nation from the younger son  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who was Rebekah’s older son?<<ANSWER>>: Rebekah’s older son was Esau. |||<<QUESTION>>: Who was Rebekah’s younger son?<<ANSWER>>: Rebekah’s younger son was Jacob.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Abraham send his servant so far away to find a wife for Isaac?<<ANSWER>>: Abraham wanted Isaac to marry a woman who obeyed God. He did not want him to marry a woman from the tribes in Canaan who worshiped idols.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Rebekah agree to leave her family and marry Isaac, whom she did not know?<<ANSWER>>: Perhaps Rebekah believed that God had led Abraham’s servant to her. She trusted God to provide the right husband for her.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why could Rebekah not have children?<<ANSWER>>: We do not know why Rebekah could not have children. She had obeyed God to leave her family and marry Isaac. Perhaps God wanted Isaac to pray for Rebekah, so that they would understand that God enabled her to become pregnant. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why were the babies struggling with each other while they were still in Rebekah’s womb?<<ANSWER>>: While the babies were in Rebekah’s womb, God had already caused them to be the kind of people that he wanted them to be. They would continue to struggle with each other throughout their lives. Also, God had already decided that they would be large nations, and that the nation from the older brother would obey the nation from the younger brother. God decided this before they were born.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why was Jacob holding on to Esau’s heel?<<ANSWER>>: Later on, Jacob would take Esau’s place by receiving the honor and possessions that should belong to the firstborn son. Perhaps Jacob was holding on to Esau’s heel as a sign that he was already trying to hold Esau back and to take his place.|||

Summary: At first, the Jews approved of the followers of Jesus because of the miracles they did and the way they lived. But they soon turned against the believers. They accused Stephen of saying evil things about Moses and God, and then killed him. After that, they persecuted the believers and forced them to leave Jerusalem and scatter to other places. But God used the persecution to cause the believers to proclaim the message about Jesus to everyone everywhere. Many people believed in Jesus at the preaching Philip and others. But God also sought out individual people, such as the Ethiopian official, who needed to hear about Jesus. Even during the persecution, God was at work to powerfully grow his church.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What lie did the unbelieving Jews tell about Stephen?<<ANSWER>>: They lied and said he was speaking evil things about Moses and God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What evil things did Stephen say the people of Israel had done?<<ANSWER>>: In the past, the people of Israel had always disobeyed God, rejected the Holy Spirit, and killed God’s prophets. But Stephen said that they had now done something even worse—they had killed the Messiah  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the religious leaders do to Stephen when they heard what he said about them?<<ANSWER>>: They dragged Stephen out of the city and threw stones at him to kill him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Stephen ask God to do for the religious leaders?<<ANSWER>>: Stephen asked God not to hold it against them that they were stoning him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the believers do when the persecution forced them to leave Jerusalem?<<ANSWER>>: They fled to other places and continued to preach about Jesus everywhere they went  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who did the Holy Spirit tell Philip to go and meet on the road?<<ANSWER>>: He told Philip to meet an important official from Ethiopia, who was riding in his chariot  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What was the official reading when Philip approached him?<<ANSWER>>: He was reading what the prophet Isaiah wrote about a man who was silent as a lamb when he was killed  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who did Philip say Isaiah had written about?<<ANSWER>>: Philip said Isaiah had written about Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the Ethiopian ask to do when they came to some water?<<ANSWER>>: The Ethiopian asked Philip if he could be baptized  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to Philip after he baptized the Ethiopian?<<ANSWER>>: The Holy Spirit took Philip away to another place where he continued to tell people about Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Stephen respond when he was arrested and brought before the high priest and other leaders?<<ANSWER>>: Even though people had lied about Stephen, he boldly proclaimed the message about Jesus. He was not afraid to tell the leaders that they had sinned and disobeyed God. |||<<QUESTION>>: What was Stephen’s attitude toward the Jews who killed him?<<ANSWER>>: Stephen did not condemn the people who killed him. Instead, he was gracious to them and asked God not to punish them for killing him. He loved his enemies even as he was dying.|||<<QUESTION>>: Did the persecution of the believers stop the message about Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: God used the persecution of the believers to spread the message about Jesus even further than Jerusalem. Before the persecution, the believers only preached in Jerusalem. But after the persecution started, they scattered everywhere and preached the message wherever they went.|||<<QUESTION>>: What was Philip doing when the Holy Spirit told him to go to the wilderness to meet the Ethiopian?<<ANSWER>>: Philip was preaching in Samaria, and many people were believing in Jesus as a result. However, the Holy Spirit sent Philip away from Samaria to meet only the Ethiopian. It seems that it was so important that the Ethiopian believed that God took Philip away from speaking to many other people. Philip obeyed God and went.|||<<QUESTION>>: When Philip approached the Ethiopian, how was it exactly the right time for the Ethiopian to hear about Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: The Ethiopian was reading about the Messiah in the book of the prophet Isaiah, but did not know that Isaiah was writing about Jesus. The Holy Spirit brought Philip to the Ethiopian at exactly the right time when he was willing to listen to God’s message. Because Philip came to him then, the Ethiopian quickly believed and was baptized.|||<<QUESTION>>: Who suggested that the Ethiopian be baptized?<<ANSWER>>: The Ethiopian himself knew that he should honor Jesus by being baptized in his name. Therefore, he asked Philip to baptize him. Philip did that, and the Ethiopian continued on to his home, happy to know Jesus.|||

Summary: Even while the Israelites suffered as slaves in Egypt, God was blessing them. He was also preparing Moses to rescue them, even while Moses was only a baby. He guided what happened to Moses so that he could meet Moses in the wilderness and send him to rescue the Israelites. He told Moses that he was Yahweh, their God and the God who had promised their ancestors that he would continue to bless them and give them the land of Canaan.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Why did the Egyptians make the Israelites slaves?<<ANSWER>>: They were afraid of the Israelites because there were so many of them  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God do for the Israelites while they were slaves in Egypt?<<ANSWER>>: God blessed them so they had even more children  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Pharaoh try to stop the Israelites from having larger families?<<ANSWER>>: Pharaoh ordered his people to kill all the Israelite baby boys  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the Israelite woman put her baby boy in a basket in the river?<<ANSWER>>: She did not want him to be killed. Perhaps she hoped someone would find him floating in the basket and rescue him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who did Pharaoh’s daughter hire to nurse the baby boy?<<ANSWER>>: Pharaoh’s daughter hired the baby’s own mother to nurse him, although she did not know that she was his mother  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Moses kill the Egyptian?<<ANSWER>>: He was trying to save the Israelite whom the Egyptian was beating  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did God appear to Moses?<<ANSWER>>: God appeared to Moses in a bush that was on fire, but which did not burn up  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God send Moses to the Israelites?<<ANSWER>>: God told Moses to bring the Israelites out of slavery in Egypt and to lead them to the land of Canaan  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God say that his name was?<<ANSWER>>: God told Moses that his name was **I AM WHO I AM** or **I AM**  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God send Aaron to help Moses?<<ANSWER>>: Moses said he did not speak well, so God sent his brother Aaron to help him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: God led the Israelites to Egypt. Why did they suffer there?<<ANSWER>>: God sent the Israelites to Egypt to protect them during the famine  . However, the Egyptians later began to treat them badly and made them slaves. They suffered even though they had obeyed God. But God blessed them even while they suffered in Egypt.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Moses’ mother defy Pharaoh’s order to kill all the Israelite baby boys?<<ANSWER>>: She knew that it was wrong to kill her son. Therefore, she did not obey Pharaoh. She hid Moses as long as she could, and then placed him a basket in the river so that someone might rescue him. By doing so, She made it possible for Moses to later rescue Israel from Egypt.|||<<QUESTION>>: How was Moses’ mother able to care for Moses?<<ANSWER>>: God caused Pharaoh’s daughter to find Moses and want to keep him as her son. Then God caused her to hire Moses’ own mother to nurse him. In this way, God blessed Moses’ mother for refusing to obey Pharaoh and for doing what was right.|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to Moses when he tried to rescue his fellow Israelite?<<ANSWER>>: Moses killed the Egyptian in order to save an Israelite. But then he had to flee from Egypt so Pharaoh would not kill him. It was not yet time for Moses to help the Israelites. And God did not want Moses to save them by his own power. Instead, God sent Moses into the wilderness until God was ready to send him to deliver the Israelites.|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God tell Moses his name was?<<ANSWER>>: God said he was **Yahweh**, which means ***I AM WHO I AM***. That means God always exists and does not depend on anyone else. He also said he was **the God of your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob**. That means he is the same God that they worshiped hundreds of years before Moses. And he is the same God who made a lasting covenant with them.|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Moses respond when God told him to go to Pharaoh?<<ANSWER>>: Moses was afraid and did not want to go. Even though he was raised as part of the royal family of Egypt, he was not sure he could do what God told him to do. But God was kind to him and sent Aaron to help him.|||

Summary: The disciples did not understand that the Messiah had to die for the sins of people. Therefore, they were so discouraged when Jesus died that it was difficult for them to believe that he was alive again—even when there was so much proof that he was alive. However, Jesus appeared alive to many of the disciples over a period of 40 days in order to prove to them from the word of God that he was the Messiah and had risen from the dead. He them sent the Holy Spirit to give them power so they could tell people everywhere to repent, believe in him, and obey all that he commanded us. Meanwhile, he is sitting at the right hand of God and ruling over everything.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What were the two disciples talking about as they went to a nearby town?<<ANSWER>>: They were talking about what had happened to Jesus. The women had said Jesus was alive, so they did not know what to believe  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who did the disciples think Jesus was?<<ANSWER>>: They thought he was a foreigner who did not know what had happened in Jerusalem  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus explain to the two disciples?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus explained what God’s word said about the Messiah—how he would suffer and die, and then rise again on the third day  .|||<<QUESTION>>: When did the two disciples to recognize Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: They recognized him when he broke the bread with them  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Jesus convince the disciples in Jerusalem that he was not a ghost?<<ANSWER>>: He showed them his hands and feet, and then ate a piece of fish before them  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What is the message that the prophets said Jesus’ disciples would proclaim?<<ANSWER>>: They would tell everyone to repent so God will forgive their sins. They would tell this to people everywhere, starting in Jerusalem  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How many people saw Jesus at one time after he rose from the dead?<<ANSWER>>: More than 500 people saw him at the same time  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus command his disciples to do?<<ANSWER>>: He told them to make disciples in all people groups, and to baptize them and to teach them to obey everything that he had commanded them  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Where did Jesus go 40 days after he rose from the dead?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus went up to heaven and sat down at the right hand of God to rule over all things  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the two disciples on the road did not believe that Jesus had risen from the dead?<<ANSWER>>: They had thought Jesus was the Messiah, so it was very difficult and discouraging for them when he died. Perhaps they did not want to believe the report from the women so that they would not be disappointed again if Jesus was not really alive. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the two disciples did not recognize Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: It seems as if Jesus prevented the two disciples from recognizing him. Perhaps he wanted them to believe the things the prophets had written about him in God’s word before he revealed himself to them. From the time Jesus went back to heaven, people have not been able to see him, and must believe in him because of what God’s word says about him.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the disciples in Jerusalem not believe Jesus was alive when he first appeared to them?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus had told the disciples that he would become alive again after three days. The woman had also seen him alive at the tomb and told the disciples. And the two disciples who saw Jesus on the road told them that Jesus was alive. Even so, when Jesus appeared among them in the room, they thought he was a ghost. It is amazing that they did not believe he was alive even with so much proof. They only understood clearly after Jesus explained to them the things written about him in God’s word. |||<<QUESTION>>: What must people do in order for God to forgive them?<<ANSWER>>: People must repent in order for God to forgive them. That is, they must change their minds about themselves and confess that they are sinners, and change their minds about God and confess that Jesus died to pay for their sins.|||<<QUESTION>>: To whom are Jesus’ disciples to speak his message?<<ANSWER>>: We are to proclaim God’s message about Jesus to all people groups everywhere. |||<<QUESTION>>: How long are Jesus’ disciples to proclaim his message?<<ANSWER>>: We are to continue to proclaim his message until there are disciples among all people groups who obey everything that Jesus commanded us.|||<<QUESTION>>: How does Jesus help his disciples to proclaim his message?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus sent the Holy Spirit to give power to his disciples so they can proclaim his message to everyone everywhere.|||<<QUESTION>>: What is Jesus doing as his disciples proclaim his message?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus is in heaven ruling over all things at the right hand of God. This encourages his disciples, as they know that he will enable them to do what he has commanded us. He will cause disciples to believe in him in every people group.|||

Summary: God told Moses that he would do one final plague that would force Pharaoh to let the Israelites go. He also told him to have the Israelites kill a perfect lamb and put its blood around the door of their houses. The Israelites did exactly as God told them to do. The blood showed that they had believed and obeyed God. When God saw the blood, he spared the firstborn son of that household. The Egyptians, however, did not believe or obey God. They did not have the blood of the lamb on their doors to protect them. So God killed all of their firstborn sons. When this happened, Pharaoh and all the Egyptians knew that Yahweh was more powerful than Pharaoh and all the gods of Egypt. They finally agreed to let the Israelites go. God freed the entire nation from being slaves in Egypt, just as he had told Moses that he would do.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Who was God going to kill in this final plague?<<ANSWER>>: He would kill the firstborn males of the Egyptian people and animals  . |||<<QUESTION>>: God had already sent nine plagues on Egypt. Did Pharaoh now believe that God would send another plague?<<ANSWER>>: No, Pharaoh did not believe God would kill the firstborn males even though God had already sent nine plagues  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did people in Egypt need to do to save their firstborn sons?<<ANSWER>>: To save their firstborn sons, they needed to kill a perfect lamb and put its blood around the door of their houses. Then they must roast the meat of the lamb and eat it with unleavened bread  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to the Israelites with the lamb’s blood around their doors?<<ANSWER>>: God passed over the houses with the blood on the doors and did not kill the firstborn sons inside  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to the Egyptians who did not put the blood on their doors?<<ANSWER>>: God killed the firstborn son of every Egyptian who did not put the blood on their doors. It did not matter if they were poor or rich. Every one of them died ([11:06](11/06), [11:07](11/07)).|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Pharaoh do after this plague?<<ANSWER>>: Pharaoh told Moses and Aaron to take the Israelites and to leave Egypt immediately. All the Egyptian people also asked them to go away  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Pharaoh not believe that God would kill the firstborn males in Egypt?<<ANSWER>>: Pharaoh had every reason to believe that God would do what he said. God had already sent nine plagues, just as he said he would. However, Pharaoh did not want to lose his power, so he choose not to believe God or to obey him, despite all the evidence that God has shown to him.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did each family need to kill a lamb in order to be saved from the plague?<<ANSWER>>: God could have simply spared all of the Israelites. Instead, he required that they kill a perfect lamb. God wanted each person to decide to obey him.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God tell the Israelites to put the blood of the lamb around the door of their houses?<<ANSWER>>: When they put the blood of the lamb around their door, they showed God and other people that they believed God would save them from the plague. They trusted that the blood of the lamb would be enough to protect them from being killed.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why were the people to eat unleavened bread?<<ANSWER>>: God wanted the people to believe that he would take them out of Egypt immediately after the plague. They were to hurry to get ready to leave Egypt quickly. They would not have time to wait for bread to rise. Instead, they would prepare it without leaven, so they could eat soon. Unleavened bread was therefore a symbol that they were eating quickly.|||<<QUESTION>>: Did God really kill the firstborn sons? Even the children?<<ANSWER>>: God did exactly what he promised to do. He killed the firstborn son of any Egyptian family that did not kill the lamb and put its blood on the door. He did not spare the people who refused to believe and obey him.|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Pharaoh respond to this final plague?<<ANSWER>>: Pharaoh was forced to finally obey God. God knew how to cause Pharaoh to let the people go. He also knew how to show Pharaoh that he was more powerful than Pharaoh and all the gods of Egypt. When the firstborn sons of Egypt died, Pharaoh let the people go exactly as God had told Moses he would do. |||

Summary: God knew that Pharaoh would be stubborn and would not easily let the Israelites leave Egypt. But God wanted to show that he was more powerful than Pharaoh or the gods of Egypt. Therefore, God sent nine plagues that punished the Egyptians for not obeying God. Each plague was more severe and caused the Egyptians to suffer more. During the plagues, God also protected the Israelites to show them that he was their God and that they were his people. Pharaoh continually refused to let the people go even as the Egyptians suffered from the plagues. However, God planned to send a final plague to force Pharaoh to obey him.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: How did Pharaoh respond when Moses told him that God wanted him to let the Israelites go?<<ANSWER>>: Pharaoh not only refused to let the Israelites go, he also made work harder than before  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God do to Egypt when Pharaoh refused to let the Israelites go?<<ANSWER>>: God sent ten terrible plagues that caused the people of Egypt to suffer greatly and to even die  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Pharaoh respond to Moses when the frogs covered Egypt?<<ANSWER>>: Pharaoh begged Moses to take away the frogs. However, he still did not let the Israelites go  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Pharaoh act deceitfully about the plague of the flies?<<ANSWER>>: Pharaoh promised Moses that the Israelites could leave Egypt if Moses stopped the plague. But when Moses did that, Pharaoh changed his mind and did not let them go  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did God treat the Egyptians differently than the Israelites during the plague of the skin sores?<<ANSWER>>: God caused the sores on the Egyptians, but not on the Israelites  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Pharaoh again act deceitfully about the plague of the hail?<<ANSWER>>: Pharaoh again promised Moses that the Israelites could leave Egypt if Moses stopped the plague of the hail  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did God again treat the Egyptians differently than the Israelites during the plague of the darkness?<<ANSWER>>: God caused the darkness on the Egyptians, but there was light where the Israelites lived  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God decide to do to the Egyptians since Pharaoh refused to obey God after the first nine plagues?<<ANSWER>>: God decided to send a final plague that would be worse than the other nine plagues. This one would cause Pharaoh to let the Israelites leave Egypt  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Did God know that Pharaoh would not let the Israelites go when Moses asked him?<<ANSWER>>: God already knew that Pharaoh would be stubborn and would not agree to let the Israelites go at first. However, he expected Moses and Aaron to tell Pharaoh what God had said and to wait for God to change Pharaoh’s mind.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God send the ten plagues on Egypt?<<ANSWER>>: God wanted to show Pharaoh and all the people in Egypt that Yahweh is more powerful than Pharaoh and all the gods of Egypt. Even the other nations would hear about how God had forced Pharaoh to obey him and let the people go.|||<<QUESTION>>: What kinds of things did God cause to be plagues on the Egyptians?<<ANSWER>>: God used the normal things of Egypt to punish them. He turned the Nile River, animals, insects, and even the sun into plagues that caused them to suffer. The Egyptians used to worship all of these things as gods before the plagues happened.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God cause some of the plagues to happen only to the Egyptians, and not to the Israelites?<<ANSWER>>: Through the plagues, God was showing the Egyptians and the Israelites that the Israelites belonged to him as his people. He protected the Israelites from many of the plagues so everyone would know that he was their God. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God send ten plagues instead of sending only the last plague?<<ANSWER>>: God knew that the first nine plagues would not convince Pharaoh to obey him. However, those plagues showed all the people how powerful God was. When God had done that, he was ready to send the final plague to force Pharaoh to let the people go.|||

Summary: The world was perfect when God created it. But Adam and Eve sinned against God. As a result, they and their ancestors became sinners and enemies of God. But God chose to make a way for there to be peace between God and people. He sent his Son, Jesus, as a great high priest to sacrifice himself as the Lamb of God to pay for our sins. No other sacrifice could do that. Everyone who believes in Jesus belongs to God, and God will not punish them. God wants people from every people group to believe in Jesus and be part of his kingdom when he will rule over the entire universe with justice and peace.
QuestionAnswers: '<<QUESTION>>: What was the world like when God rested from its creation?<<ANSWER>>: Everything was perfect, and there was no sin, sickness, or death. Adam and Eve loved each other and they loved God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do people die?<<ANSWER>>: Everyone dies because Adam and Eve sinned against God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God promise that the Messiah would do to Satan?<<ANSWER>>: God promised that the Messiah would take away Satan’s power forever  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the sacrifices that the priest offered to God accomplish?<<ANSWER>>: These sacrifices showed people that they had sinned, and that they deserved God''s punishment  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who did God say he would bless through Abraham?<<ANSWER>>: God said he would bless all the people groups on earth through Abraham  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do we call Jesus the “Lamb of God?”<<ANSWER>>: God gave Abraham a lamb to sacrifice instead of his son, Isaac. In the same way, Jesus died in our place as a sacrifice for our sins. That is why he is called the “Lamb of God”  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How is Jesus like the Passover lamb?<<ANSWER>>: Just as God spared the Jews who put the blood of the lamb on their doors, he will not punish the person for whom Jesus shed his blood  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why is Jesus a greater prophet than Moses?<<ANSWER>>: Everything Jesus did and said were the actions and words of God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why is Jesus able to rule forever?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus is the descendant of King David and also the Messiah. Therefore, he will rule forever  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why is there evil, suffering, and death in the world?<<ANSWER>>: People do evil things, suffer, and die because Adam and Eve sinned against God. They became sinners because of that, and so did all of their descendants. As a result, every person in the world is a sinner. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why is there no peace between God and people?<<ANSWER>>: When Adam and Eve sinned, they and their descendants became enemies of God. Therefore, there is no peace between God and people. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God require sacrifices if they cannot save people from their sins?<<ANSWER>>: God required sacrifices in order to show them that only Jesus, the perfect high priest, could offer a sacrifice that would take away their sins. Any other sacrifice does not save us, but only shows us that we need to believe in Jesus.|||<<QUESTION>>: Who does God want to save from their sins?<<ANSWER>>: God wants to save people from every people group from their sins. Therefore, we must proclaim the message about Jesus to every people group so they can believe in Jesus and be saved. |||<<QUESTION>>: How does the Lamb of God keep God from punishing those who believe in him?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus was perfect, and never sinned. Therefore, when he shed his blood, he died to pay the penalty for our sins, and not for his own. We can be confident, then, that God will not punish us, since Jesus has already paid for our sins.|||<<QUESTION>>: How does a person accept the New Covenant?<<ANSWER>>: The New Covenant that God made with us means that anyone who believes in Jesus belongs to God. It is no longer necessary to obey the Law (that is, the Old Covenant) in order to be saved. Jesus already completely fulfilled the Law. We only need to believe in him in order to be saved.|||<<QUESTION>>: How is Jesus a greater king than King David?<<ANSWER>>: King David ruled over Israel. But Jesus will rule over the entire universe. Therefore, he is a greater king than his ancestor, King David.|||'

Summary: God chose to bless Jacob even before he was born, and he was faithful to do that. However, Jacob did not always act in a way that was right. He often deceived other people in order to get what he wanted. Nevertheless, God knew that Jacob wanted to worship God. Also, God promised Abraham that he would bless his descendants. Therefore, God blessed Jacob even when he fled from his brother. He brought Jacob back to Canaan again, and blessed his family. Jacob was not always right, but he believed God.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: How did Isaac and Rebekah treat their sons differently?<<ANSWER>>: Isaac loved Esau more than he loved Jacob. Rebekah loved Jacob more than she loved Esau  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Esau give to Jacob in exchange for some food?<<ANSWER>>: Esau was the firstborn. As the firstborn, he deserved to receive more of his father’s possessions then Jacob, and to be honored more than Jacob. However, Esau traded all those things to Jacob in exchange for some food  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Rebekah and Jacob deceive Isaac by having Jacob pretend to be Esau?<<ANSWER>>: Rebekah and Jacob wanted Isaac to bless Jacob instead of blessing Esau  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jacob put goatskins on his neck and hands?<<ANSWER>>: Jacob wanted his hands and neck to be hairy like his brother Esau’s hands and neck. In that way, Isaac would feel the goat hair and think he was Esau  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Esau plan to do to Jacob after Jacob stole his blessing?<<ANSWER>>: Esau planned to wait until Isaac died, and then to kill Jacob  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Rebekah do to prevent Esau from killing Jacob?<<ANSWER>>: Rebekah and Isaac sent Jacob far away to her relatives so Esau would not kill him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How long did Jacob stay away from home?<<ANSWER>>: Jacob stayed with Rebekah’s relatives for twenty years. Then he returned home with the family God had given him while he was away  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Jacob try to convince Esau not to kill him?<<ANSWER>>: He sent many herds of animals to Esau as a gift so that Esau would not still want to kill him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Did Esau still want to kill Jacob?<<ANSWER>>: Esau was no longer angry with Jacob, and did not want to kill him. Esau and Jacob both lived in Canaan, and even buried their father together  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Rebekah love Jacob more than she loved Esau?<<ANSWER>>: Jacob stayed around the home where Rebekah lived. Furthermore, God had told Rebekah that her older son would serve the younger.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Isaac love Esau more than he loved Jacob?<<ANSWER>>: Esau loved to hunt. Perhaps Isaac also loved to hunt, and to eat the wild animals that they killed. This may be the reason he loved Esau more than he loved Jacob.|||<<QUESTION>>: What problems happened because Isaac and Rebekah each loved a different son?<<ANSWER>>: Jacob and Esau would have known that their parents did not love them equally. Perhaps this is why Jacob and Esau continually struggled with each other. They both tried to get what the other brother had. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why was Esau willing to trade what was his as the firstborn for some food?<<ANSWER>>: Esau did not care about the promises God made to Abraham. He was only interested in his food for that day. Later, he wanted to receive his father’s inheritance. But he was not interested in receiving anything from God.|||<<QUESTION>>: Jacob deceived Isaac to get his blessing. What does this tell us about Jacob?<<ANSWER>>: It was good that Jacob wanted to have his father’s blessing. But he was wrong to deceive his father in order to receive it. Because he did that, he had to flee from his brother and spend twenty years in another country. |||<<QUESTION>>: Was Jacob a good person?<<ANSWER>>: Jacob sometimes obeyed God, and he wanted God’s blessing. At the same time, Jacob had many faults. He often tried to trick people to get what he wanted. Nevertheless, God blessed Jacob because he had promised to Abraham that he would bless his descendants.|||

Story Title: The Story of the Good Samaritan
Summary: The expert in the law who came to Jesus did not believe in Jesus, and he did not really understand God’s law. Instead, he wanted to embarrass Jesus. Jesus knew this, and so he questioned the man about the law. He then told a story that showed how a follower of God should treat other people. God gives eternal life to people who believe in him and obey him, rather than to people who hold powerful religious positions. When the simple Samaritan was merciful to the injured man, he acted more like God than do the most religious people in Israel.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Did the expert in the Jewish law really want to know how to have eternal life?<<ANSWER>>: No, he only wanted to show that Jesus was teaching wrongly  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Where did Jesus tell the man to find the answer to his question?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus asked the man to see what was written in God’s law  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus say would happen to the man if he did what God’s law told him to do?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus said the man would have eternal life if he did what God’s law told him to do  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the man ask Jesus who his neighbor was?<<ANSWER>>: The man wanted to show people that he was living correctly  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus tell a story to the man?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus told the man a story in order to answer his question about who was his neighbor  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the priest and the Levite do when they saw the injured man?<<ANSWER>>: The priest and the Levite both ignored the injured man and did not help him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why was it surprising that the Samaritan helped the injured Jewish man?<<ANSWER>>: The Samaritans and the Jews hated each other  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Which of the men was merciful to the injured man?<<ANSWER>>: The Samaritan was the only one who was merciful to the injured man  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus tell the expert in the Jewish law to do?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus told the expert in the Jewish law to be merciful to people in need, just as the Samaritan in the story did to the injured Jewish man  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why was it surprising that Jesus asked the expert in the Jewish law about what was written in God’s law?<<ANSWER>>: The man knew far more about the Jewish law than any other person in Israel. He continually studied it and taught it to others. However, he did not really understand what the law meant. Therefore, Jesus started questioning him about the law so that he could show the man that he did not really know what God’s law taught.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the man asked Jesus who his neighbor was?<<ANSWER>>: The man knew God’s law said to love his neighbor as himself. But he also knew that he did not love other people as he should. Therefore, he asked about his neighbor because he was hoping that he only needed to love a few specific people in order to obey the law.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why might Jesus have chosen to talk to this man about a priest and a Levite?<<ANSWER>>: The Jews considered the priests and Levites to be the most spiritual people in Israel. They also considered the experts in the law to be very much like the priests and the Levites. Because the experts studied and taught God’s law, people assumed they knew more about God than other people did. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why might the expert in the Jewish law have been offended when Jesus compared the actions of the priest and the Levite to the actions of the Samaritan?<<ANSWER>>: The expert in the Jewish law considered the priests and the Levites to be good people, but he hated the Samaritan. He thought all Samaritans were sinners. However, in the story that Jesus told him, the Samaritan was the only person who acted kindly to the injured Jewish man. |||<<QUESTION>>: How much did the Samaritan show mercy to the injured man?<<ANSWER>>: The Samaritan did not merely help the injured man a little bit. Instead, he did more for the injured man than anyone would expect him to do. He bandaged him, took him to the inn, and paid all of the expenses for the man. |||<<QUESTION>>: What does the story tell us about loving our neighbor?<<ANSWER>>: The Samaritan saw another person who had a serious need. Although the man was a stranger from a people that the Samaritans hated, he felt compassion for him. He took care of the man, doing more than was necessary or expected to help him. He treated the injured man as he would like to be treated himself if he was in need. This is what it means to be a neighbor to someone.|||

Summary: The Israelites left Egypt to go to the Promised Land, along with people from other nations who saw what God did to the Egyptians and believed in him. But God was not finished with the Egyptians. He caused Pharaoh to change his mind and chase after the Israelites so he could destroy Pharaoh completely. He made a way for Israel to escape through the Red Sea. But he killed all the Egyptians when they tried to follow them. In this way, he showed the Israelites and all the other nations that he was more powerful than Pharaoh and the gods of Egypt. He also showed the Israelites that he would lead and protect them as they traveled to the Promised Land.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Who also left Egypt along with the Israelites?<<ANSWER>>: Some people from other nations who believed in God also left Egypt along with the Israelites  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did God lead the Israelites?<<ANSWER>>: God sent a tall pillar of cloud during the day. It became a pillar of fire at night. It went ahead of the Israelites to show them where to go. God was in this pillar  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Pharaoh change his mind about letting the Israelites go?<<ANSWER>>: God caused Pharaoh to change his mind so that he could show everyone that he is more powerful than Pharaoh and all the gods of Egypt  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why were the Israelites afraid when they saw the Egyptian army coming?<<ANSWER>>: They were trapped between the Egyptians and the Red Sea. They thought the Egyptians would kill them  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did God do to protect the Israelites from the Egyptians?<<ANSWER>>: God moved the pillar of cloud between the Israelites and the Egyptians so the Egyptians could not see the Israelites  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What happened when Moses raised his hand over the sea?<<ANSWER>>: God caused the wind to push the water to the left and to the right so that there was a path through the sea for the Israelites. The Israelites crossed the sea on dry ground  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to the Egyptians when they followed the Israelites into the sea?<<ANSWER>>: God caused the Egyptians to panic and their chariots to get stuck. Then he closed the water over the Egyptians so that they all drowned  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did the Israelites believe about Moses?<<ANSWER>>: They believed that he was a prophet of God  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How do the Israelites remember every year that God defeated the Egyptians?<<ANSWER>>: Every year, the Israelites celebrate the festival of the Passover by killing and eating a lamb with unleavened bread  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think some people from other nations went with the Israelites from Egypt?<<ANSWER>>: They would have seen all the plagues that God did to the Egyptians. Perhaps that is why they believed that Yahweh is God. They decided to follow him instead of the gods of Egypt. |||<<QUESTION>>: God had already forced Pharaoh to let the Israelites leave Egypt. Why did he make Pharaoh chase after them again?<<ANSWER>>: Perhaps other nations would not know that God forced Pharaoh to let the Israelites go. God caused Pharaoh to chase after the Israelites so that he could completely destroy the Egyptians. In this way, people in every nation would hear about it and know that God was more powerful than Pharaoh and the gods of Egypt. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God lead the Israelites to the Red Sea where they would be trapped, instead of leading them around it?<<ANSWER>>: God wanted to use the Red Sea to destroy the Egyptians and to show the Israelites how powerful he was. For this reason, God led them to the edge of the sea instead of around it.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why were the Egyptians not able to immediately catch the Israelites before they finished crossing the sea?<<ANSWER>>: There were so many Israelites that it would have taken a long time for them to all cross the sea. However, God placed the pillar of cloud behind them so the Egyptians could attack them as they were crossing the sea. |||<<QUESTION>>: What did the Israelites do when they realized the Egyptians were dead?<<ANSWER>>: The Israelites rejoiced and worshiped God. They realized that he had save them from dying and from being slaves. They were very happy and decided to obey God. They continued to celebrate the festival of the Passover every year as God commanded them to do.|||

Summary: When Abram and Sarai were old, they still did not have a son as God had promised. Therefore, Sarai told Abram to have a son through her servant. Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram, but God had not chosen to keep his covenant with Abram through Ishmael. Instead, God allowed Sarai to give birth to Isaac in their old age. He was the son of promise. God tested Abraham to see if he would obey God and kill Isaac. When Abraham showed he was ready to do that, God stopped him and provided a ram for the sacrifice. God promised to bless the world through Abraham’s family because Abraham obeyed him.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Why did Sarai tell Abram to have a child with Hagar?<<ANSWER>>: Sarai was now too old to have children  . The custom of that time allowed a woman to have a child through their servant.|||<<QUESTION>>: What was the name of the son born to Abram through Hagar?<<ANSWER>>: Abram named the son that Hagar bore him Ishmael  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God tell Abram to do to show his covenant with God?<<ANSWER>>: As a sign of the covenant God made with Abram, God told Abram to circumcise every male in his family  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Who would be the **son of promise**?<<ANSWER>>: Sarai would bear a son for Abram. His name would be Isaac. He would be the **son of promise**  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What were the meanings of the new names that God gave to Abram and Sarai?<<ANSWER>>: Abraham means ***father of many*** and Sarah means ***princess***  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How old were Abraham and Sarah when Isaac was born?<<ANSWER>>: Abraham was 100 years old and Sarah was 90 years old  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God tell Abraham to do to his son Isaac?<<ANSWER>>: God told Abraham to kill Isaac as a sacrifice to God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Where did Abraham tell Isaac that they would get the lamb for the sacrifice?<<ANSWER>>: Abraham told Isaac that God would provide the lamb for the sacrifice  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Did God want Abraham to actually kill Isaac as a sacrifice?<<ANSWER>>: No, God told Abraham not to kill Isaac. God was only testing Abraham to see if he would obey God. God provided a ram for the sacrifice instead of Isaac  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God say that he would bless Abraham?<<ANSWER>>: God said he would bless Abraham because Abraham was willing to give God everything, even his only son ([05:10](05/10)).|||<<QUESTION>>: Should Sarai have told Abram to have a son with her servant Hagar?<<ANSWER>>: The custom of the day allowed Sarai to have a son through her servant. But perhaps Sarai did this because she did not believe God could give Abram a son in their old age. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why was Isaac called the **son of promise**?<<ANSWER>>: Isaac was the **son of promise** because God would fulfil his promise to bless all nations through him. Even though Ishmael was also Abram’s son, God had chosen to bless Abraham’s descendants through Isaac instead of through Ishmael  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God give new names to Abram and Sarai?<<ANSWER>>: In the Old Testament, people were often named according what kind of people they were, or what they would do. God gave Abram and Sarai new names to show that they would have many descendants and would be honored by them. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God test Abraham by asking him to kill Isaac?<<ANSWER>>: God tested Abraham to show that Abraham would obey God no matter what God asked him to do. He would even sacrifice Isaac, his son of promise. |||<<QUESTION>>: Was Abraham willing to kill Isaac as God asked?<<ANSWER>>: Yes, Abraham was willing to obey everything God told him to do. He was ready to kill Isaac when God told him to stop  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God provide a ram for the sacrifice?<<ANSWER>>: Abraham told Isaac that God would provide a lamb for the sacrifice. But at that time, God provided a ram instead  . Abraham was speaking about a sacrifice in the future when God would provide a perfect lamb. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God say that Isaac was Abraham’s only son?<<ANSWER>>: Ishmael was also the son of Abraham. But Isaac was the son of promise that God had chosen to bless. Isaac was the only son through whom God would keep his covenant.|||

Story Title: God Raises Jesus from the Dead
Summary: Jesus had told the disciples and other people the he would become alive again after three days. Surprisingly, the disciples did not remember this, nor come to the tomb to see if he would rise again. Only the women came, and even they did not expect Jesus to be alive. The only people who seemed to remember that he promised to rise again were the unbelieving religious leaders. They remembered what Jesus said, and tried to stop people from believing that he would rise from the dead. They posted soldiers to make sure his body remained in the tomb. But they could not stop the plan of God. An angel struck down the soldiers, and Jesus rose with power.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What were the Jewish leaders afraid the disciples would do with the body of Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: They were afraid the disciples would steal Jesus’ body and say he had risen from the dead  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Pilate make sure the disciples could not steal Jesus’ body?<<ANSWER>>: Pilate let them placed a seal on the entrance of the tomb, and also stationed some soliders there to guard it.  .|||<<QUESTION>>: When did the women come to the tomb?<<ANSWER>>: The women came to the tomb after the Sabbath day was over  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the woman plan to do at the tomb?<<ANSWER>>: The women wanted to put more spices on Jesus’ body  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who rolled the stone away from the tomb?<<ANSWER>>: An angel from heaven rolled the stone away from the tomb  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the soldiers do when they saw the angel?<<ANSWER>>: The soldiers were so afraid that they fell to the ground like dead men  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the angel tell the women had happened to Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: The angel told them that Jesus was not there, but that he had risen from the dead  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the angel tell the women to say to the disciples?<<ANSWER>>: He told them to tell the disciples that Jesus had risen from the dead, and would go ahead of them to Galilee  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the women do when Jesus appeared to them as they were on their way?<<ANSWER>>: The woman fell down and worshiped Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who was it that remembered Jesus’ promise to rise from the dead in three days?<<ANSWER>>: It is surprising that the disciples did not remember the Jesus said he would rise from the dead in three days. Instead, it was the unbelieving Jewish leaders who remembered what he said. They did not believe him, but they did remember his words. The disciples should have remembered.|||<<QUESTION>>: Were the soldiers able to prevent the tomb from opening?<<ANSWER>>: The Roman soldiers were the best soldiers of that time. However, they could not stand against the single angel that God sent to open the tomb. The strongest military force could not stop God from doing what he planned to do. When the angel appeared, they fell down like dead men.|||<<QUESTION>>: How did the angel treat the women who came to the tomb?<<ANSWER>>: The angel knew that the women had come to honor Jesus by putting spices on his body. Therefore, the angel spoke kindly to them and told them not to be afraid. He showed them the empty tomb, and told them that Jesus would meet them in Galilee.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think Jesus met the women, when he told them the same thing as the angel?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus did not need to appear to the women. The angel had already told them that he was alive and would meet the disciples in Galilee. But Jesus also knew that the women had come to honor him. Perhaps he appears to them for that reason, so he could honor them for coming to serve him. The women were therefore the first people to see Jesus after he became alive again. |||

Summary: God always sent prophets to tell the Israelites to worship only him. But the people hated the prophets and refused to listen to them. They served idols instead of Yahweh. They even tried to kill the prophets whom God sent to them. But the prophets continued to speak for God, and God continued to care for his prophets. The prophets warned the people to repent or God would punish them. Even so, God still promised that he would send the Messiah to them.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Why did King Ahab try to kill the prophet Elijah?<<ANSWER>>: Ahab was angry with Elijah because Elijah said there would be no rain in the kingdom of Israel. Elijah said this because Ahab and the people of the kingdom of Israel worshiped an idol named Baal  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did God provide for Elijah while he hid from Ahab at the stream?<<ANSWER>>: God sent birds to bring Elijah bread and meat to eat while he hid from Ahab  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did God provide for Elijah while he lived with the widow and her son?<<ANSWER>>: God caused the widow’s jar of flour and bottle of oil to never become empty. For about three years, there was always enough food for them to eat even though there was no other food in the land  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did Elijah tell the people to decide about when they came with the prophets of Baal to Mount Carmel?<<ANSWER>>: Elijah told the people that they should stop changing their mind about God. If Yahweh is God, they should worship him, but if Baal is God, they should worship him instead  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did Elijah say the people could tell whether Yahweh or Baal was the true God?<<ANSWER>>: Elijah and the prophets of Baal would prepare a sacrifice on an altar. The people would know that the God who responded by sending fire onto the altar was the true God  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What happened when the prophets of Baal asked Baal to send fire on the altar?<<ANSWER>>: Nothing happened when they asked Baal to send fire  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What happened when Elijah asked Yahweh to send fire on the altar?<<ANSWER>>: Fire fell from the sky and burned up the altar and everything around it  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did God heal Naaman of his skin disease?<<ANSWER>>: Elisha told Naaman to dip himself in the Jordan River seven times. At first, he refused. But then he changed his mind and did what Elisha told him to do. God healed him as soon as he obeyed  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did the people try to kill the prophet Jeremiah?<<ANSWER>>: They put Jeremiah into a dry well and left him there to die. But later, the king sent his servants to pull him out  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Who did the prophets remind the people that God promised to send to them?<<ANSWER>>: The prophets reminded them that God would send the Messiah to them  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did the people usually respond to the prophets whom God sent to them?<<ANSWER>>: The people did not believe what the prophets said. Instead, they hated the prophets and often tried to kill them. In spite of this, the prophets continued to speak to the people for God.|||<<QUESTION>>: How did the prophet Elijah survive during the drought and the famine that it caused?<<ANSWER>>: When there was no rain in the kingdom of Israel, there was also very little food. During that time, God provided food for Elijah in special ways. For a while, he sent birds to bring food to Elijah. Then he caused the food of a poor widow to never end so she could feed Elijah. God took care of Elijah because Elijah obeyed God and spoke God’s messages to the people.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Elijah tell the people to pour water on his sacrifice?<<ANSWER>>: Elijah told the people to pour water on his sacrifice in order to make it harder for it to burn. He wanted the people to know that Yahweh was truly the one who burned up the sacrifice. Therefore, he made the sacrifice so wet that only God could cause it to burn. He knew that nothing was too difficult for God.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Naaman not go to the river immediately when Elisha told him to go?<<ANSWER>>: Perhaps Naaman thought what Elisha told him to do was too simple to cure his disease. At first, he thought he would have to do something more difficult in order to be healed. However, when he did the easy thing Elisha told him to do, he was healed!|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the prophets say the people must do so that God would not destroy them?<<ANSWER>>: The prophets told the people they must repent. That is, they must change their mind about God and begin to think about him in a different way. They must understand that Yahweh is the true God and stop worshiping other gods. If they did not repent, God would destroy them because they sinned against him. |||

Summary: Jesus suffered greatly as he died. The soldiers mocked and mistreated him. The religious leaders and the crowd mocked him. Even one of the robbers on a cross beside him mocked him. Despite this, Jesus remained on the cross and suffered in order to make a way for God to forgive sinners. He was willing to die in order to obey his Father and finish the task that he came to do. One of the robbers understood this, and went to heaven with Jesus. One of the soldiers also saw that Jesus was truly the Son of God. And two of the religious leaders believed in Jesus and honored him by burying his body. God was honored even through the death of his Son.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What did the soldiers force Jesus to carry?<<ANSWER>>: They forced him to carry the cross on which he would die  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus ask his Father to do for the soldiers who crucified him?<<ANSWER>>: He asked his Father to forgive them, for they did not understand what they were doing  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the sign above Jesus’ head say?<<ANSWER>>: The sign said **King of the Jews**  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus promise to the robber who asked Jesus to remember him?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus promised him that he would be with Jesus that very day in Paradise  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the Jewish leaders and people in the crowd tell Jesus to do so that they might believe in him?<<ANSWER>>: They told Jesus to come down from the cross and to save himself  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to the sky as Jesus was on the cross?<<ANSWER>>: The sky became completely dark for three hours in the middle of the day  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus cry out to his Father as he died?<<ANSWER>>: He said that it was finished, and gave his spirit into his Father’s hands  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to the curtain in the Temple when Jesus died?<<ANSWER>>: The curtain was torn in two from the top to the bottom  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the the Roman soldier say about Jesus when he died?<<ANSWER>>: The soldier said the Jesus was certainly innocent, and that he was the Son of God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who buried Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Two Jewish leaders named Joseph and Nicodemus buried Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Joseph close the tomb?<<ANSWER>>: He rolled a large stone in front of the tomb to block the entrance  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think Jesus said the soldiers did not know what they were doing?<<ANSWER>>: The soldiers were Romans who did not know very much about the Jewish religion. They probably thought Jesus was an ordinary criminal, and they treated him as one.|||<<QUESTION>>: They soldiers gambled for Jesus’ clothing. Why does that help us believe Jesus was the Messiah?<<ANSWER>>: This action was one of many things that the scriptures, written hundreds of years before, said they would do to the Messiah. All these prophesies were fulfilled in Jesus.|||<<QUESTION>>: Jesus told the robber who repented that he would be with Jesus in Paradise that day. What does that tell us about the way to enter into heaven?<<ANSWER>>: The robber did not perform a single good deed. Instead, he simply confessed that he was a sinner, and asked Jesus to remember him in the kingdom. As a result, Jesus promised that he would be in Paradise (that is, heaven) that same day. The way to enter into heaven is to believe in Jesus.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think Jesus did not come down from the cross and save himself when the people asked him to?<<ANSWER>>: The people who told Jesus to come down from the cross did not want to believe in him. They were only mocking him. They did not realize that he had the power to come down from the cross. But he came to earth to die for sinners. That was the will of his Father. He had to stay on the cross and give up his own life in order to make it possible for God to forgive other people who believed in Jesus. |||<<QUESTION>>: What was finished when Jesus cried out?<<ANSWER>>: When Jesus cried out, “It is finished!” he wanted to say that he had finished paying the penalty for the sins of everyone in the world. It was now possible for God to forgive those who repented and trusted in Jesus. People no longer needed to die for their own sins.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why was the curtain of the Temple torn from top to bottom?<<ANSWER>>: The curtain of the Temple prevented people from seeing or entering into the most holy place in the Temple where God was. God in heaven above tore the curtain from the top to the bottom when Jesus died. He did this to show that Jesus had opened a way for man to approach God through the sacrifice of Jesus.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the soldier say that Jesus was innocent, and the Son of God?<<ANSWER>>: The Roman soldier had probably executed hundreds of criminals. He recognized that Jesus did not act like a criminal. Instead, he was a good man who asked his Father to forgive the soldiers, and who spoke kindly to the robber who repented. Furthermore, the miraculous signs that happened when Jesus died convinced the soldier that Jesus was not just a man—he was the Son of God.|||

Summary: Jesus could not die for the sins of other people if he himself were a sinner. Therefore, the Holy Spirit led Jesus into the wilderness so that Satan could tempt him. God wanted to prove to Satan and everyone else that Jesus never sinned, even though Satan personally tried to make him sin. Jesus was weak, tired, and hungry. Even so, he never sinned. He refused to do what Satan told him to do. He understood when Satan used scripture to try to trick him into testing God. And Jesus chose not to accept all the wealth and power in the world from Satan. Instead, he faithfully waited until God would make him ruler over the world. This would not happen until after he had suffered for our sins.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus go out into the wilderness?<<ANSWER>>: The Holy Spirit led him into the wilderness  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus do in the wilderness before Satan came to tempt him?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus had fasted for 40 days and 40 nights before Satan came to tempt him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Satan tell Jesus to do the first time he tempted him?<<ANSWER>>: Satan told Jesus to turn the rocks into bread so he could eat.  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus say was more important than eating bread?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus said it was more important to obey God than to eat bread  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Satan say that Jesus would not be hurt if he jumped off the top of the Temple?<<ANSWER>>: Satan said the angels of God would catch Jesus so that he would not hit the ground  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus refuse to jump off the top of the Temple?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus did not want to test God, and God had not told him to jump off the Temple  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What was the only thing Satan told Jesus to do in order to receive all the kingdoms of the world?<<ANSWER>>: Satan told Jesus he would give him all the kingdoms of the world if he would bow down and worship Satan  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Did Jesus do any of the sinful things that Satan tempted him to do?<<ANSWER>>: No, Jesus refused to do any of the things that Satan told him to do  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think Satan tempted Jesus to turn a stone into bread?<<ANSWER>>: Satan knew that Jesus was very hungry after he had fasted for 40 days and nights. Satan often uses a person’s weakness when he tries to tempt them.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the Holy Spirit led Jesus into the wilderness to fast for 40 days?<<ANSWER>>: God wanted to prove that Jesus would not sin. To show this, he caused Jesus to be weak and hungry. Yet, even though Jesus was weak, he did not sin. He did not do what Satan told him to do. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Satan quote from the scripture when he told Jesus to jump off the top of the Temple?<<ANSWER>>: Satan knows the scripture and can quote it. However, he does not use the scripture in the correct way. He tries to give the scripture meanings that God did not intend for it to have. Satan only uses the scripture to deceive people.|||<<QUESTION>>: Did Satan really have the authority to offer all the kingdoms of the world to Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus did not contradict Satan when. There is no reason to believe that Satan cannot give people wealth and power in this world. |||<<QUESTION>>: How was Satan trying to deceive Jesus by offering him all the kingdoms of the world?<<ANSWER>>: The things in this world will end. However, only God can give wealth and power that lasts forever in heaven. Jesus correctly chose to wait until God gave him all the kingdoms of the world so that he could rule forever in heaven. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why was it impossible for Jesus to worship Satan even for a short time in order to receive the kingdoms of this world from Satan?<<ANSWER>>: God demands that people serve him alone. It is never right to serve Satan or anyone else—not even for a short time. We are to worship God only. We sin if we worship anyone or anything other than God.|||

Summary: Jesus went to the city of Nazareth in Galilee, the place where he grew up. The people there came together every week to worship God. However, they were not ready to believe that Jesus came from God. When he showed them in the scriptures that he was doing the work of the Messiah, they did not want to believe him. And when Jesus told them that God would accept people from other nations who believed in him, they were so angry that they tried to kill Jesus. Therefore, he left them and went away to preach to other people in Galilee. Many saw the works he did and believed in him. From those who believed, Jesus then chose 12 men to be with him as his apostles. They traveled with him, and he began to teach them so they could tell people about him.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: How did Jesus receive power to do the things that he did?<<ANSWER>>: The Holy Spirit was giving him power  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the people of Nazareth know Jesus well?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus lived in Nazareth when he was a child  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who wrote the scroll that the leaders asked Jesus to read?<<ANSWER>>: The leaders asked Jesus to read the scroll that the prophet Isaiah wrote  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who was the scripture about that Jesus read?<<ANSWER>>: The scripture that Jesus read was about the Messiah  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why were the people amazed?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus said the things he had read were happening right then. He wanted to say that the Messiah was doing those things right then. Have you seen this happen?|||<<QUESTION>>: Jesus did not directly tell the people of Nazareth that he was the Messiah. Instead, he read the scripture and said it was happening right then. Why do you think Jesus revealed himself in this way?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus knew that the people of Nazareth did not want to accept that he was the Messiah. Therefore, instead of stating that as a fact, he read the scripture and said that it was talking about him.
