They were wrong. Jesus spoke about Elijah and Elisha to show that God also loved people of other nations. God send the prophets to help the people who would believe in him. But he did not send them to help the Jews when the Jews did not serve him.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus choose 12 men to be his apostles?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus knew that he would die for our sins. After he would die, someone would have to be able to tell everyone what Jesus had done for us. Therefore, Jesus chose 12 men to prepare them to teach about him. They traveled with him and he taught them so they would be ready to be witnesses for him when he went back to heaven. |||

Summary: God brought the Israelites to Mount Sinai just as he had promised Moses. He came down on the mountain with powerful signs and gave them the Ten Commandments and other laws to obey. He told them how to sacrifice to him, and how to meet him in the Tent of Meeting. But while Moses was still on the mountain with God, the people made an idol to worship. God was very angry and wanted to destroy them. Moses was also so angry that he smashed the Ten Commandments. But Moses prayed for the people and God forgave them.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What did God say the Israelites would become if they kept his covenant with them?<<ANSWER>>: They would become his prized possession, a kingdom of priests, and a holy nation  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What were the signs of God’s presence when he came down on the mountain?<<ANSWER>>: There was thunder, lightning, smoke, and sounds of loud trumpets  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What was the first command that God gave to the people?<<ANSWER>>: God told them not to worship any other god  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What were the Israelites supposed to do on the seventh day of the week?<<ANSWER>>: They were supposed to keep the Sabbath day holy by resting and remembering God  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What would God do to the people if they did not obey his commandments?<<ANSWER>>: God would punish them if they did not obey him  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Who was allowed to enter into the room in the Tent of Meeting where God was?<<ANSWER>>: Only the high priest was allowed to go into that room  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What would the blood from an animal sacrifice do to the sin of the person who brought the animal?<<ANSWER>>: The blood of the animal would cover that person’s sin. He would become clean in God’s sight  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the people make an idol to worship?<<ANSWER>>: Moses remained on the mountain for a long time, and the people grew tired of waiting for him. Therefore, they asked Aaron to make an idol for them to worship  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did Moses do when he came down the mountain and saw the people worshiping the idol?<<ANSWER>>: He smashed the two stone tablets on which God had written the Ten Commandments. He then destroyed the idol and made the people drink the dust of it in water  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God forgive the people?<<ANSWER>>: He forgave them because Moses prayed for them  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God bring the people to Mount Sinai?<<ANSWER>>: This was the place where God had spoken to Moses from the burning bush. He promised Moses that he would bring the people out of Egypt to worship him there. God kept that promise and led them to that same place. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God say the Israelites would be a kingdom of priests?<<ANSWER>>: Priests help other people worship God. They also teach people what God has said. All the people of Israel would be able to do these things for the other nations if they would obey God.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God write the Ten Commandments on tablets of stone?<<ANSWER>>: God wanted the people to always remember his commandments. Perhaps that is why he wrote them on hard stone tablets with his own hand, instead of on clay, wood, or paper. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God tell the Israelites to make a tent where he could meet them?<<ANSWER>>: The Israelites were traveling to the Promised Land. They could not build a temple which would be in one place. Instead, God told them to make a special tent that they could move with them and set up when they stopped in a place.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think God said the blood of the sacrifice would cover a person’s sin?<<ANSWER>>: The sin of the person would still be there, but it would be covered. God would look at the blood instead of their sin, and would consider that person to be clean before him.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why was it especially evil that the people made an idol to worship?<<ANSWER>>: The first and most important command God gave them was not to worship any other god.|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God send on the people to punish them for worshiping the idol?<<ANSWER>>: God send a plague on them, which killed many of them. In Egypt, God sent plagues on the Egyptians. Now, God punished his own people with a plague because they sinned.|||

Summary: When Jesus was arrested and tried, everyone who should have defended him turned against him instead. The religious leaders rejected the Messiah that God sent to them. Peter denied that he knew Jesus. And Pilate ordered his soldiers to crucify Jesus even though he knew that Jesus was innocent. But God used all of these evil things to accomplish his plan. He wanted Jesus to die in order to make a way for God to forgive sinners. And Jesus was willing to die in order to accomplish God’s plan.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Where did the soldiers first take Jesus after they arrested him?<<ANSWER>>: They took him to the house of the high priest  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did the Jewish leaders do to try and prove that Jesus was guilty?<<ANSWER>>: They brought many false witnesses who lied about Jesus. However, the witnesses did not agree with each other, so they could not prove that Jesus was guilty of anything  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What question did the high priest ask Jesus, and how did Jesus answer?<<ANSWER>>: The high priest asked if Jesus was the Messiah, and the Son of the living God. Jesus told the high priest that this was who he was  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did the Jewish leaders react when Jesus said he was the Messiah and the Son of God?<<ANSWER>>: They all became angry and shouted that Jesus deserved to die. They blindfolded him, spit on his, hit him, and mocked him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Peter say when people outside the high priest’s house said he had been with Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Peter swore and said he did not know Jesus  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Judas do to himself after Jesus was arrested?<<ANSWER>>: Judas went away and killed himself  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What question did Pilate ask Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Pilate asked Jesus if he was the king of the Jews  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus say his servants would not fight to defend him?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus’ kingdom was not on earth, so his servants did not fight on earth to save him  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did Pilate decide about whether Jesus was guilty?<<ANSWER>>: Pilate decided that Jesus was not guilty of anything, and told this to the crowd three times  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Pilate tell his soldiers to crucify Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Pilate was afraid the crowd would riot, so he ordered his soldiers to crucify Jesus in order to satisfy the crowd. Therefore, they whipped Jesus and prepared to kill him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What was the only charge the high priest was able to bring against Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus had not done anything wrong, so the high priest could not find true witnesses against him. Finally, he accused Jesus of pretending to be the Messiah and the Son of God. Jesus really was God’s Son, so he was not pretending. He was innocent, but the high priest would not believe him. Therefore, the whole group of religious leaders condemned Jesus.|||<<QUESTION>>: How is it encouraging to followers of Jesus that Peter denied Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Peter was one of Jesus’ closest disciples. He truly believed in Jesus, and became a leader in the church. However, even Peter denied Jesus when the people accused him. No believer is perfect. Jesus does not expect us to always do the right thing. Just as Jesus loved Peter in spite of his failure, followers of Jesus know he will forgive them when they repent of their sin.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think God allowed Jesus to be falsely accused and condemned?<<ANSWER>>: God knows that people will do evil things, and causes them to do his will. Jesus needed to die so God could forgive sinners. So God allowed the Jewish leaders and the Romans to convict Jesus even though they knew he was innocent. Evil actions do not stop God’s plan or his will from happening.|||

Story Title: The Story of the Unmerciful Servant
Summary: Peter asked Jesus how many times he should forgive a fellow disciple who sinned against him. He thought that perhaps seven times would be enough. But Jesus told him that he should continue to forgive his brother even 70 times more than that. Jesus then told a story to show that God is like a king who has forgiven his disciples a great debt of sin. Therefore, his disciples should also forgive their fellow disciples. The debt that they owe each other is much less than the debt they owed to God. If his disciples do not forgive each other, God will be angry with them and will punish them.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus mean when he told Peter to forgive his brother 70 times seven?<<ANSWER>>: When Jesus told Peter to forgive his brother 70 times seven, he wanted to say that Peter should forgive his brother as many times as necessary without stopping  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How would the king get his money back by selling the servant and his family as slaves?<<ANSWER>>: The king would take the money that he would receive from selling the man and his family as slaves. This money would be a partial payment toward what the servant owed the king  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Would the servant ever be able to repay the money he owed to the king?<<ANSWER>>: Since the servant owed 200,000 years’ wages, he would not be able to repay the king in his lifetime  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Would the servant who owed four months’ wages be able to repay the other servant?<<ANSWER>>: The servant who owed four months’ wages might have been able to repay the other servant if he had time to earn the money  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why were the other servants disturbed by what happened?<<ANSWER>>: The other servants thought the servant whom the king forgave had treated the other servant unfairly. He should have forgiven the other servant  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why was the king so angry?<<ANSWER>>: The king was angry because he had forgiven the debt of the servant, but now he saw that the servant was a wicked man. He was not willing to forgive other people as the king had forgiven him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: For how long did the king put the wicked servant into prison?<<ANSWER>>: The king put the servant into the prison until he could repay his debt. However, his debt was so large that he would never be able to repay it. Therefore, he would be in prison for the rest of his life  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus tell this story?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus wanted his disciples to know that God had forgiven them, and that he expected them to forgive each other in the same way  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think Peter offered to forgive his brother seven times?<<ANSWER>>: Peter apparently thought that he was being merciful if he forgave his brother seven times. That seemed like a lot to Peter. However, Jesus answered that seven times was not enough. Disciples of Jesus should forgive 70 times more than that. That is, they should forgive their brothers without limit.|||<<QUESTION>>: How did the debts of the two servants compare to each other?<<ANSWER>>: The debt of the first servant was so large that it would be impossible to repay. The debt of the second servant was significant, but not impossible to pay. |||<<QUESTION>>: Who do you think the king and the servants represent in this story?<<ANSWER>>: In this story, the king represents God. The servants represent the disciples of Jesus. Every disciple owed God a payment for his sin that was impossible to pay, just as the servant owed the king a huge debt. However, God forgave their sin because Jesus died in their places. Therefore, God expects his disciples to forgive each other. |||<<QUESTION>>: How will God respond to disciples who do not forgive other disciples?<<ANSWER>>: God will be very angry with disciples who are not willing to forgive other disciples. He will judge them severely.|||

Summary: Solomon began as a good and wise king who ruled Israel well. However, he married many women who worshiped foreign gods. Eventually, Solomon also began to worship these idols. God was angry with Solomon and decided to divide Israel into two kingdoms. Ten tribes followed Jeroboam and formed the kingdom of Israel. Jeroboam made idols so the people would not go to Jerusalem to worship Yahweh at the Temple. All the kings of the kingdom of Israel were evil. Two of the tribes formed the kingdom of Judah and chose descendants of David as their kings. However, many of their kings were also evil. Even though they were descendants of David, they refused to obey God. The two kingdoms fought against each other for many years.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What did Solomon ask God to do for him?<<ANSWER>>: He asked God to make him very wise  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the people no longer offer sacrifices at the Tent of Meeting?<<ANSWER>>: Solomon build the Temple for which David had planned and prepared. People now offered sacrifices and worshiped God there instead of at the Tent of Meeting  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Solomon married almost 1,000 women. How did that cause Solomon to sin?<<ANSWER>>: Many of the women Solomon married were foreign women. They brought their gods with them, and Solomon started to worship those false gods  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did God say he would punish Solomon for worshiping other gods?<<ANSWER>>: God said he would punish Solomon by dividing the nation of Israel into two kingdoms after Solomon died  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the people rebel against Rehoboam?<<ANSWER>>: They asked him to make them work less than Solomon did. Instead, Rehoboam said he would make them work harder. This made them angry, so they refused to serve him  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How many of the tribes of Israel remained with Rehoboam?<<ANSWER>>: Only two of the 12 tribes remained with Rehoboam  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jeroboam make so the people would no longer go to Jerusalem to worship?<<ANSWER>>: He made two idols for the people of the kingdom of Israel to worship  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How many of the kings of the kingdom of Israel were evil?<<ANSWER>>: All of the kings of the kingdom of Israel were evil  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Were most of the kings of Judah good or evil?<<ANSWER>>: Some of the kings of Judah were good men, but most of them were evil. They ruled badly, worshiped idols, and even sacrificed their children to false gods  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did it please God when Solomon asked God to make him wise?<<ANSWER>>: Solomon did not ask for wealth for himself. Instead, he asked God to make him wise so that he could rule God’s people well. This pleased God, and so he also made him wealthy.|||<<QUESTION>>: What problem happened because Solomon married women from foreign countries?<<ANSWER>>: Many people from other countries believed in God, and he accepted them. Solomon was not wrong to marry foreign women. But he was wrong to marry foreign women who still served other gods. Those women continued to worship those false gods. And eventually, they caused Solomon to worship those idols as well. This made God very angry.|||<<QUESTION>>: Solomon was very wise. How was Rehoboam different than Solomon?<<ANSWER>>: Unlike his father Solomon, Rehoboam, was very foolish. The people were willing to follow him if he would treat them well. But instead, he answered the people so harshly that most of the tribes of Israel refused to follow him. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jeroboam build idols for his people to worship?<<ANSWER>>: Jeroboam may have wanted to worship idols. But he also did not want his people to continue to go to Jerusalem to worship. Jerusalem was in the kingdom of Judah. Judah was now the enemy of the kingdom of Israel. Therefore, the main reason Jeroboam made the idols was so his people would stay away from the kingdom of Judah. They worshiped the idols in the kingdom of Israel instead.|||<<QUESTION>>: The kings of Judah were descendants of David. How is it that many of them were evil?<<ANSWER>>: Even though David obeyed God, many of his children did not. Solomon obeyed God for a time, but then began to worship the idols of his foreign wives. Many of David’s other descendants also chose not to obey God. Each person had to decide for himself whether or not he would obey God.|||

Story Title: God Saves Joseph and His Family
Summary: God sometimes allows bad things to happen and people to do evil things. But God is always in control. He is doing the things that will fulfil his plan. He allowed Joseph’s brothers to sell him as a slave so that Joseph would be in Egypt. He even allowed Joseph to be in prison. But he blessed Joseph even there. Next, God cause Pharaoh to have a dream for Joseph to interpret. This made Joseph the second most powerful man in Egypt. Finally, God sent a famine throughout the land so that Jacob and his family would have to come to Egypt for food. But God had already placed Joseph in Egypt to care for them during the famine. God was always working in Joseph’s live, and Joseph was always faithful to him.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: How did Jacob feel about his son Joseph?<<ANSWER>>: Jacob loved Joseph more than he loved his other 11 sons  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Joseph’s brothers hate him?<<ANSWER>>: They hated Joseph because Jacob loved Joseph more than he loved his other sons, and because Joseph dreamed he would rule over his brothers  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Joseph’s brothers do to get rid of Joseph?<<ANSWER>>: Joseph’s brothers sold him as a slave  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the Egyptians put Joseph in prison?<<ANSWER>>: The wife of Joseph’s Egyptian master lied and said Joseph tried to sleep with her. Her husband believed her and sent Joseph to prison  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did God do for Joseph while he was in prison?<<ANSWER>>: Joseph remained faithful to God, so God blessed him even in the prison  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Joseph get out of prison?<<ANSWER>>: Pharaoh had a dream that no one could interpret  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Joseph’s brothers come to Egypt?<<ANSWER>>: There was a great famine and there was no food for them in Canaan  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Joseph treat his brothers when they came to him in Egypt?<<ANSWER>>: Joseph first tested them to see if they had changed. Then he told them who he was and promised to take care of them all in Egypt  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who became the 12 tribes of Israel?<<ANSWER>>: God changed Jacob’s name to Israel. The descendants of each of his 12 sons then became the tribes of Israel  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What mistake did Jacob make in the way he treated his sons?<<ANSWER>>: Jacob loved one of his sons more than he loved his other sons. This was the same mistake that his father Isaac made. As a result, Jacob’s sons hated Joseph and sold him as a slave.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why was God with Joseph even as a slave and as a prisoner?<<ANSWER>>: Joseph was always faithful to God, even when he suffered for doing the right thing. Therefore, God blessed Joseph and eventually restored him to his family.|||<<QUESTION>>: How did God make it possible for Joseph to go from prison to the palace in Egypt?<<ANSWER>>: God caused Pharaoh to have a dream that no one could interpret. He then revealed the meaning of the dream to Joseph. In that way, God provided a way for Joseph to be released from prison and to begin to rule over Egypt.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Joseph not punish his brothers?<<ANSWER>>: Joseph’s brothers sold him as a slave. He could have been very angry with them. But Joseph saw that God was the one who sent Joseph to Egypt through his brothers’ evil actions. God did this to save Joseph’s entire family. Therefore, Joseph forgave his brothers and took care of them. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jacob move his family to Egypt?<<ANSWER>>: God caused the famine so that Jacob would have to move his family to Egypt. God wanted them to grow into a large nation there. |||

Summary: When God first created the world, he had already decided to send the Messiah to die for people’s sins. Throughout history, God has revealed to us what the Messiah would do. He promised Adam and Eve that the Messiah would destroy Satan. He told Abraham that the Messiah would bless all the people groups in the world. He told the prophets that the Messiah would be a perfect prophet, priest, and king. He would be born of a virgin and never sin. But people would hate him and kill him anyway. God would allow this to happen so that the Messiah could die and be punished in the place of other people.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Who would crush the snake’s head?<<ANSWER>>: The Messiah, a descendant of Eve, would crush the snake’s head  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Who were the people whom the Messiah would save?<<ANSWER>>: The Messiah would save people out of every people group in the world  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How would the New Covenant be different than the old covenant?<<ANSWER>>: In the New Covenant, people would know God personally. They would love him and want to obey his laws. His law would be written on their hearts  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What perfect sacrifice would the Messiah offer to God?<<ANSWER>>: The Messiah would offer himself as a perfect sacrifice to God  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did the prophets say about the birth of the Messiah?<<ANSWER>>: The prophets said the Messiah would be born of a virgin in the town of Bethlehem  . |||<<QUESTION>>: According to the prophet Isaiah, how would people receive the Messiah?<<ANSWER>>: The prophet Isaiah said people would hate the Messiah and refuse to accept him. His friend would turn against him, and the people would kill him  . |||<<QUESTION>>: According to the prophets, why would the Messiah die?<<ANSWER>>: The Messiah would die because God would punish him for other people’s sins. He would die so they could have peace with God  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What would God do for the Messiah after he died?<<ANSWER>>: The prophets said God would raise the Messiah from the dead  . |||<<QUESTION>>: After the prophets finished speaking about the Messiah, how much time passed before God send him into the world?<<ANSWER>>: God sent the Messiah into the world 400 years after the prophets last spoke about him  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think God spoke about the Messiah to Adam and Eve, even though God would not send the Messiah for a very long time?<<ANSWER>>: When he first created the world, God already planned to send the Messiah to save us from our sins. Therefore, he began to tell people about the Messiah from the very beginning. |||<<QUESTION>>: Abraham’s descendants were the Jews, who are God’s chosen people. Why is it significant that God told Abraham that he would bless all the people groups of the world through him?<<ANSWER>>: God never planned to save only the Jews. Rather, from the very beginning, his plan was to save people from every people group in the world. However, God told Abraham that God would bless all these people through a Jewish descendant of Abraham. This descendant would be the Messiah. |||<<QUESTION>>: The New Covenant will be written on people’s hearts. Why is this important?<<ANSWER>>: The old covenant was written on tables of stone and paper. Even the Jews who received it often forgot about it and did not obey it. But God will write the New Covenant within people so they cannot forget it. Because God will change their hearts, people will obey the New Covenant. They will willingly worship and serve God.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why should we be encouraged that the Messiah never has to make another sacrifice for sin?<<ANSWER>>: The Messiah offered himself as a perfect sacrifice to God. God accepted his sacrifice in place of punishing us. Since his sacrifice was perfect, he never has to offer it again. That means God will never punish believers for their sins, since the sacrifice of the Messiah will always be enough to please God. |||<<QUESTION>>: The Messiah never sinned. Why did God allow people to kill him?<<ANSWER>>: God wanted the Messiah to die because that was the only way God could forgive people’s sins. God is holy and cannot ignore when people sin. But God punished the Messiah in the place of other people so God would not have to punish them.|||

Summary: Jesus told five stories to explain what the kingdom of God is like. The stories of the mustard seed and the yeast showed that the kingdom of God will begin small, but will become larger than all other kingdoms, filling the whole earth. The stories of the treasure and the perfect pearl showed that the kingdom of God is so valuable that people should be willing to sell all they own in order to obtain it. And the story of the two men who prayed showed that God will only accept into his kingdom people who confess their sins. He will not accept proud people who trust in their good works instead of confessing their sins.

Summary: Jesus stayed behind as he sent his disciples across the lake in the boat. While they went, he prayed to his Father until late at night. Jesus often spend much time in prayer, no matter how busy he was. Eventually, Jesus began to walk across the lake on the water toward the disciples. They were afraid when they saw him, but Peter asked permission to come to Jesus on the water. He walked partway to Jesus before he became afraid the waves and began to sink. Jesus saved Peter, but he rebuked him for not believing in Jesus enough. When Jesus got into the boat, the storm stopped. The disciples were so amazed at what Jesus had done that they all fell down and worshiped him as the Son of God.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus do after he sent his disciples across the lake in a boat?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus sent away the crowd and then went up on a mountainside to pray alone  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What difficulty did the disciples have on the lake?<<ANSWER>>: The wind was blowing hard, so the disciples were having difficulty crossing the lake in the boat  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Jesus come to the disciples?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus walked on top of the water to the boat in the middle of the lake  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why were the disciples afraid of Jesus when he came to them?<<ANSWER>>: The disciples were afraid when they saw Jesus walking on top of the water because they thought Jesus was a ghost  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Peter ask Jesus to do in order to prove that Jesus was not a ghost?<<ANSWER>>: Peter asked Jesus to command him to walk to Jesus on the water  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened when Peter stepped onto the water?<<ANSWER>>: Peter was also able to walk on the water for a short distance  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Peter begin to sink in the water?<<ANSWER>>: Peter began to sink when he took his eyes away from Jesus and looked at the waves instead  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Peter do to save himself as he was sinking in the water?<<ANSWER>>: Peter shouted for Jesus to save him. Jesus reached out and grabbed Peter  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened to the storm?<<ANSWER>>: The storm stopped as soon as Peter and Jesus stepped into the boat  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How did the disciples respond when Jesus entered the boat?<<ANSWER>>: The disciples were amazed. They all bowed down and worshiped Jesus as the Son of God  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus remain on the mountainside and pray until late at night?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus believed that prayer was important even for him. He often spent time talking to his Father. Even when he was very busy, he took time to pray. He became an example for all of his disciples, and for us.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the disciples had difficulty crossing the lake? Jesus had sent them there.<<ANSWER>>: A disciple who follows Jesus will still experience difficult times. Jesus did not say it was easy to be his disciple. In this situation, Jesus sent the wind against the disciples so he could show them that he had authority over the storm. God often causes difficult times in our lives so that he can show us his power. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think it was wise for Peter to try to walk on the water to Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: Peter often did not think carefully about things before he did them. Perhaps this occasion is an example. It may have been a foolish thing to do. But at the same time, it was also very brave. None of the other disciples tried to go to Jesus. They all remained in the boat and waited for Jesus to come to them. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus say that Peter had little faith?<<ANSWER>>: Peter began to trust Jesus. He asked to Jesus to cause him to walk on the water. That shows that Peter believed in Jesus. However, when Peter saw the wind and the waves, he began to fear that Jesus could not keep him safe on the water. His faith began to waver. At that point, he began to sink. His faith was not strong enough to trust Jesus for very long. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the disciples worship Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: The disciples saw that he had walked across the water of the lake during the storm, and that he had calmed the wind. Many of the disciples were fishermen. They knew that no mere man could walk on the water. They understood clearly that Jesus was doing things that only God could do. Therefore, they bowed down and worshiped him.|||

Summary: Jesus’ disciples were tired from preaching and teaching about Jesus. Jesus knew they needed rest, so he took them in a boat to a quiet place. However, thousands of people who wanted to see Jesus ran ahead to that place. But Jesus was not angry with them. Instead, he felt compassion for them. They did not have anyone to teach then and to care for them, so he did that. Even though there was not enough for the people to eat, Jesus multiplied the small amount of food they had and gave it to his disciples to give to the people. The food fed all of the people as much as they wanted to eat. The disciples had more food left over than they had before they fed the people. Jesus took the small amount of food that they had and enabled them to meet the needs of the entire crowd with it. Only God can do that.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus invite his disciples to go to a quiet place to rest?<<ANSWER>>: His disciples had been preaching and teaching about Jesus in many different villages, and they were tired  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did the people do in order to see Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: The people ran along the shore of the lake in order to get to the other side to be there when the boat carrying Jesus and his disciples would arrive there  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How many people were in the crowd that waited for Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: There were over 5,000 men in the crowd, but there were also many woman and children. We do not know the total number of people who were there  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did Jesus respond to the crowds that waited for him?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus had compassion on the people, because they were like sheep without a shepherd  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How much food did the disciples have with them?<<ANSWER>>: The disciples only had five loaves of bread and two small fish  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus do with the loaves and the fish?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus thanked God for the loaves and fish, broke them into pieces, and gave them to his disciples to give to the people  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What happened when the crowd ate the five loaves of bread and the two small fish?<<ANSWER>>: The bread and the fish never ran out. The crowd ate as much as they wanted and they were satisfied  .|||<<QUESTION>>: How much food was left over after the crowd ate what they wanted?<<ANSWER>>: The disciples picked up 12 baskets full of food that was left over  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Should disciples rest even when there is a lot of work to do?<<ANSWER>>: Rest is a good thing. When God created the earth, he commanded people to rest on the seventh day of the week. When the disciples finished preaching and teaching, Jesus took them away to rest. People need to rest occasionally in order to do their work well.|||<<QUESTION>>: How did Jesus respond to the crowd when they interrupted him and the disciples as they were going to a place to rest?<<ANSWER>>: Even though Jesus wanted the disciples to rest, he was not angry with the crowds that followed them. Instead, he felt compassion on the people. Even though he and his disciples needed to rest, they taught and healed the people in the crowd. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Jesus tell the disciples to give the crowd something to eat?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus knew that they did not have enough food to feed the crowd. He told the disciples to feed them so that the disciples would understand that it was impossible to do that. Then, when Jesus caused the bread and the fish to increase and feed them all, the disciples would understand that he had done what was impossible. They would know that God had worked through him in a mighty way.|||<<QUESTION>>: Who caused the food to increase?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus was the one who caused the food to increase and satisfy all the people. The disciples passed out the food to the people, but Jesus was the one who continually gave them the food. When everyone had finished eating, the disciples knew that Jesus was the one who had done this miracle.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the disciples collected the leftover food?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus wanted the disciples to see how much he had multiplied the food. The leftover food was more than the five loaves of bread and two fish that they had at the beginning. Those would fit into a single basket. But now there were 12 full baskets. Each of the 12 disciples had a full basket of leftover food.|||

Story Title: The Story of the Compassionate Father
Summary: The religious leaders worked hard to try to please God. They were angry that Jesus treated tax collectors and sinners as friends when they came to listen to his teaching. So Jesus told this story to show them why God was happy when sinners returned to him. The father in the story represents God the Father. The older son represents the religious leaders. The younger son represents the tax collectors who sinned, but were now coming back to God. Jesus wanted the religious leaders to know that it was right to celebrate that these sinners were coming to God.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Why did the religious leaders criticize Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: The religious leaders criticized Jesus because he treated the tax collectors and sinners as friends  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the man’s younger son decide to return to his father?<<ANSWER>>: The younger son had no money, and was so hungry that he wanted to eat the food he gave to the pigs. He realized that the servants of his father lived better than that  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did the man’s younger son want his father to do for him when he returned home?<<ANSWER>>: The man’s younger son wanted his father to treat him as a servant, and not as a son  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did the father do when he saw his younger son?<<ANSWER>>: The father was so happy that he ran to his younger son and hugged and kissed him  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did the man’s younger son tell his father after his father greeted him?<<ANSWER>>: The man’s younger son told his father that he had sinned against his father and against God, and that he was not worthy to be his father’s son  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the father need to go out to his older son?<<ANSWER>>: The father went out to his older son because the older son would not come into the house where they were celebrating that his younger brother had returned  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why was the man’s older son angry with his father?<<ANSWER>>: The man’s older son was angry with his father because he thought his father treated his younger son better than he treated his older son. The man’s older son thought his father should treat him better because he stayed home and worked while his younger brother went away and wasted his money  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why should the father and his older son celebrate?<<ANSWER>>: The father told his older son that they should celebrate because his younger brother had returned to them alive. This was a time to rejoice, rather than a time to be angry about the past  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the man’s younger son demand that his father give him his inheritance while his father was still alive?<<ANSWER>>: Perhaps the man’s younger son only wanted his father’s possessions, and was not interested in honoring his father  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the father agreed to give his inheritance to his sons while he was still alive?<<ANSWER>>: It seems that the father loved his sons more than he loved his possessions  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How is the younger son an example of people who run away from God and live according to their desires?<<ANSWER>>: Many people are like the younger son. They want to live according to their own desires rather than to be friends with God the Father. |||<<QUESTION>>: Do you think the father should have treated his younger son well when he returned?<<ANSWER>>: Many people would think the father should have rejected his younger son since that son abandoned him. However, the father in the story was merciful, just as God the Father is merciful. He continued to love his son and accepted him with joy when he returned. |||<<QUESTION>>: How should people who have sinned, but who now want to come to God, expect God to treat them?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus told this story to people who had sinned, but who were then coming to God. He wanted them to know that God will accept them when they come to him. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think some believers want to make it difficult for people who have sinned to come to God?<<ANSWER>>: Some believers do not think it is fair that God accepts people who have sinned without punishing them. In this story, Jesus showed that God will not punish people who have sinned when they come to him and ask him to forgive them. |||

Summary: Many descendants were soon born to Noah. But, even though Noah was a righteous man, his descendants did not obey God. They refused to fill the earth. Instead, they built a city and a tower to honor themselves. Therefore, God confused their language so they would separate into groups. Later, God chose Abram and promised to bless every language group through his descendants. Abram believed God would do this, even though he did not have a son. Therefore, God was pleased with Abram and declared him righteous.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Why was is wrong for the people to gather together in one city?<<ANSWER>>: God had commanded Noah and his descendants to fill the earth again after the flood  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What was the purpose of the tower the people built in the city?<<ANSWER>>: They built the tower to be tall enough to reach heaven  . Some scholars think they wanted to be able to go up to heaven. Other scholars think they wanted the gods to be able to come down from heaven.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God change their language?<<ANSWER>>: God changed their one language into many languages so they could not understand each other  . As a result, they could not work together to continue building the tower or living together well. So they spread out over the earth in different language groups.|||<<QUESTION>>: Who did God say he would bless through Abram?<<ANSWER>>: God would bless all the people groups on earth through Abram and his descendants  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What land did God give to Abram?<<ANSWER>>: God gave the land of Canaan to Abram and his descendants  . He said they would always possess it. This is the land of Israel today.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Abram give a tenth of his possessions to Melchizedek?<<ANSWER>>: Melchizedek was a priest of God  . That is, he spoke for God and helped people worship God. Abram gave a tenth of his possessions to Melchizedek as an offering to God. In this way, Abram honored God. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why might it have been difficult for Abram to believe that he would have many descendants?<<ANSWER>>: Abram and Sarai did not yet have a son  . Without a son, he could not have many descendants. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God declare that Abram was righteous?<<ANSWER>>: God said Abram was righteous because Abram believed God  . Abram believed he would have many descendants even though he did not yet have a son.|||<<QUESTION>>: Noah was a righteous man. Why did his descendants begin to sin?<<ANSWER>>: God destroyed all the wicked people in the flood  . So only the family of Noah survived to fill the earth. Although Noah obeyed God, he was not perfect. He received wicked desires from his ancestors, Adam and Eve. And he passed these on to his descendants. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the people want to live in one city?<<ANSWER>>: The descendants of Noah became proud and wanted other people to honor and remember them. Therefore, they decided they did not want to obey God. Instead, they settled in one place where they could honor each other  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Why do people today speak different languages?<<ANSWER>>: People today speak different languages because God gave them different languages at Babel  . He wanted each language group to spread out across the earth and learn to honor him.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why did God send Abram to Canaan?<<ANSWER>>: Abram already honored God where he lived. But, God told him to go to Canaan, the land that God would give to him. God wanted Abram’s descendants to have a land where they could honor God. In this way, all the families of the earth could learn through them how to honor God. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did Abram give his tenth to Melchizedek instead of directly to God?<<ANSWER>>: Melchizedek was the first priest of God. Before that, Noah and other righteous people offered their sacrifices directly to God. But now God was providing a priest to help people honor God and to speak to them for him. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why was God’s promise to Abram so surprising?<<ANSWER>>: God promised that Abram would have more descendants then the stars in the sky. No one is able to count all the stars! But Abram and Sarai did not yet have a son. It would not have seemed possible that they could have so many descendants. |||

Summary: John told people to repent and prepare for the kingdom of God. Many people came to him and repented that they had sinned. Jesus also came so John could baptize him, even though Jesus never sinned. God the Father spoke from heaven to say that Jesus, his Son, pleased him. And the Holy Spirit came in the form of a dove to show that he was with Jesus.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: Where did John live?<<ANSWER>>: He lived in the wilderness, apart from other people  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What was the message that John preached to the people?<<ANSWER>>: John told the people to repent, for the kingdom of God is near  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did people respond when they heard John’s message?<<ANSWER>>: Some of the people repented from their sins and John baptized them. However, many of the religious leaders who came to John did not repent  . |||<<QUESTION>>: To what did John compare the religious leaders who did not repent?<<ANSWER>>: He compared them to poisonous snakes  . |||<<QUESTION>>: How did John respond when the religious leaders asked him if he was the Messiah?<<ANSWER>>: John told them that he was not the Messiah, but that the Messiah was coming after him  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What was the title that John called Jesus when Jesus came to John?<<ANSWER>>: John called Jesus the Lamb of God who will take away the sin of the world  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did John not want to baptize Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: John said he was not worthy to baptize Jesus, but that Jesus should baptize John instead  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What came down and landed on Jesus after John baptized him?<<ANSWER>>: After John baptized Jesus, the Spirit of God came down in the form of a dove and rested on Jesus  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What did God say about Jesus when he spoke from heaven?<<ANSWER>>: God said that Jesus was his Son, and that he was very pleased with Jesus  . |||<<QUESTION>>: What had God told John about the person on whom the Holy Spirit would stay?<<ANSWER>>: God told John that the person on whom the Holy Spirit would stay would be the Son of God  . |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think John preached in the wilderness instead of in a city?<<ANSWER>>: Perhaps John wanted to preach God’s message to people who wanted to listen. Few people lived in the wilderness, so people had to make an effort to go there in order to hear John. Most of the people who came to John were serious about listening to his message.|||<<QUESTION>>: John told people to repent, for the kingdom of God was near. Why was his message so simple?<<ANSWER>>: John’s message was indeed very simple. However, he told the people everything they needed to know at that time. That is, the Messiah was coming soon to establish his kingdom. People had to repent of their sins if they wanted to participate in that kingdom. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why do you think the religious rulers came to John?<<ANSWER>>: The religious rulers did not come to John to repent of their sins. Perhaps they were curious about why other people were coming to see him. Or perhaps they were jealous that people were coming to John instead of coming to them. We know John did not think the leaders came for good reasons, because he called them poisonous snakes. Even today, some people come to hear preaching for evil reasons.|||<<QUESTION>>: How did John show that he was a humble man?<<ANSWER>>: John openly said that he was not the Messiah, and that he was not worthy to untie the sandals of the Messiah. He also told Jesus that he was not worthy to baptize him. John is an example for us. He was a great prophet, but he knew the Messiah was greater than he was.|||<<QUESTION>>: How can Jesus be both the Messiah and the Lamb of God?<<ANSWER>>: The Messiah is the only person who did not sin. Therefore, he was the only one who could be a perfect sacrifice to God. In that way, he was punished for the sins of everyone in the world who believes in him. |||<<QUESTION>>: Why did the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit appear together when Jesus was baptized?<<ANSWER>>: By appearing together, they demonstrated that the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit are all working together to save people from their sins, and to enable them to enter into the kingdom of God. When Jesus was baptized, he was doing what God the Father wanted him to do. The Holy Spirit guided Jesus to prepare him to do the work of the Messiah and to become the Lamb of God. |||

Summary: It has been almost 2,000 years since Jesus went up to heaven, but he will return just as he said he would. He is waiting for us to bring in the harvest by telling everyone about him. Some will believe in Jesus, but many will not believe in him and will even persecute us, his servants. But when the time is right, Jesus will return to judge those who did not believe in him, and will throw them into hell forever. However, he will create a new heaven and earth where he will rule forever together with everyone who believes in him. We will be with him in perfect peace forever.
QuestionAnswers: <<QUESTION>>: When did Jesus say the end of the world would happen?<<ANSWER>>: He said his disciples would preach the good news about the kingdom of God to people everywhere in the world, and then the end would come  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Will Jesus’ servants be treated well in the world?<<ANSWER>>: No, Jesus said the important people in this world would torture and kill them because of him  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What did an enemy do to the field where a man planted good seed?<<ANSWER>>: His enemy planted weeds in the field to ruin his crop  .|||<<QUESTION>>: When the world ends, what will God’s angels do to all the people who belong to the devil and not to God?<<ANSWER>>: His angels will gather the people who belong to the devil together and throw them into a very hot fire where they will suffer terribly  .|||<<QUESTION>>: When the world ends, what will happen to the people who are righteous and have followed God?<<ANSWER>>: They will shine like the sun in the kingdom of God their Father  .|||<<QUESTION>>: When Jesus returns, what will happen to every follower of Jesus who has died?<<ANSWER>>: They will rise from the dead and meet him in the sky  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What will Jesus give to everyone who believes in him?<<ANSWER>>: He will give them a crown, and they will rule with God forever and have perfect peace  .|||<<QUESTION>>: Where will God throw everyone who does not believe in Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: He will throw them into hell, where they will suffer forever and burn continually in a fire that never goes out  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What will happen to Satan when Jesus returns?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus will completely destroy Satan and his kingdom and throw him into hell, where he will burn there forever  .|||<<QUESTION>>: What will happen to this earth when Jesus returns?<<ANSWER>>: God will destroy the present heaven and earth and create a new heaven and earth that will be perfect.|||<<QUESTION>>: Should we be concerned that Jesus has not come back to earth for almost 2,000 years?<<ANSWER>>: No, we should not be worried. Jesus promised to return at the end of the world, and he will keep his promise.|||<<QUESTION>>: What should followers of Jesus be doing as we wait for him to return?<<ANSWER>>: We should be living in a holy way that honors Jesus, and telling other people about his kingdom.|||<<QUESTION>>: What did Jesus want to say when he said, “The fields are ripe for harvest”?<<ANSWER>>: He wanted to say that at any time, there are many people in the world who are ready to believe in Jesus.|||<<QUESTION>>: Should we let persecution stop us from telling people about Jesus?<<ANSWER>>: No, people killed Jesus, and he said they will also torture and kill his servants. Jesus expects us to be faithful just as he was faithful to God.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why are there so many evil people in the world?<<ANSWER>>: Jesus said Satan places evil people in the world just as an enemy placed weeds in a man’s field. These people will grow up together with believers, but God’s angels will separate them out at the judgement.|||<<QUESTION>>: Why will Jesus give us a crown?<<ANSWER>>: He will give a crown to everyone who believes in him as a sign that they will rule with him forever. This should encourage us in this life.|||<<QUESTION>>: Will God always allow evil and Satan to be in the world?<<ANSWER>>: No, God will throw Satan and every evil person into hell where they will suffer forever. He will even destroy this earth where sin has been, and create a new heaven and earth that will be perfect. That is where believers will live forever with God.|||
